dialogue.text: You decided.

dialogue.speaker: KAT
dialogue.text: This from someone whose diary is devoted to favorite grooming tips?

dialogue.speaker: WALTER
dialogue.text: Enough!

dialogue.speaker: WALTER
dialogue.text: My insurance does not cover PMS

dialogue.speaker: KAT
dialogue.text: Then tell them I had a seizure.

dialogue.speaker: WALTER
dialogue.text: Is this about Sarah Lawrence? You punishing me?

dialogue.speaker: KAT
dialogue.text: I thought you were punishing me.

dialogue.speaker: WALTER
dialogue.text: Why can't we agree on this?

dialogue.speaker: KAT
dialogue.text: Because you're making decisions for me.

dialogue.speaker: WALTER
dialogue.text: As a parent, that's my right

dialogue.speaker: KAT
dialogue.text: So what I want doesn't matter?

dialogue.speaker: WALTER
dialogue.text: You're eighteen.  You don't know what you want.  You won't know until you're forty-five and you don't have it.

dialogue.speaker: KAT
dialogue.text: I want to go to an East Coast school! I want you to trust me to make my own choices.  I want --

dialogue.speaker: WALTER
dialogue.text: Was that your sister?

dialogue.speaker: KAT
dialogue.text: Yeah.  She left with some bikers Big ones.  Full of sperm.

dialogue.speaker: WALTER
dialogue.text: Funny.

dialogue.speaker: WALTER
dialogue.text: I don't understand the allure of dehydrated food.  Is this something I should be hip to?

dialogue.speaker: KAT
dialogue.text: No, Daddy.

dialogue.speaker: WALTER
dialogue.text: So tell me about this dance. Was it fun?

dialogue.speaker: KAT
dialogue.text: Parts of it.

dialogue.speaker: WALTER
dialogue.text: Which parts?

dialogue.speaker: KAT
dialogue.text: The part where Bianca beat the hell out of some guy.

dialogue.speaker: WALTER
dialogue.text: Bianca did what?

dialogue.speaker: KAT
dialogue.text: What's the matter?  Upset that I rubbed off on her?

dialogue.speaker: WALTER
dialogue.text: No -- impressed.

dialogue.speaker: WALTER
dialogue.text: You know, fathers don't like to admit that their daughters are capable of running their own lives.  It means we've become spectators.  Bianca still lets me play a few innings.  You've had me on the bleachers for years.  When you go to Sarah Lawrence, I won't even be able to watch the game.

dialogue.speaker: KAT
dialogue.text: When I go?

dialogue.speaker: WALTER
dialogue.text: Oh, Christ.  Don't tell me you've changed your mind.  I already sent 'em a check.

dialogue.speaker: MISS PERKY
dialogue.text: Katarina Stratford.  My, my.  You've been terrorizing Ms. Blaise again.

dialogue.speaker: KAT
dialogue.text: Expressing my opinion is not a terrorist action.

dialogue.speaker: MISS PERKY
dialogue.text: Well, yes, compared to your other choices of expression this year, today's events are quite mild.  By the way, Bobby Rictor's gonad retrieval operation went quite well, in case you're interested.

dialogue.speaker: KAT
dialogue.text: I still maintain that he kicked himself in the balls.  I was merely a spectator.

dialogue.speaker: MISS PERKY
dialogue.text: The point is Kat -- people perceive you as somewhat ...

dialogue.speaker: KAT
dialogue.text: Tempestuous?

dialogue.speaker: MISS PERKY
dialogue.text: No ... I believe "heinous bitch" is the term used most often.

dialogue.speaker: KAT
dialogue.text: Am I supposed to feel better? Like, right now?  Or do I have some time to think about it?

dialogue.speaker: MISS PERKY
dialogue.text: Just smack her now.

dialogue.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogue.text: Hey there.  Tired of breathing?

dialogue.speaker: MANDELLA
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogue.text: Cool pictures.  You a fan?

dialogue.speaker: MANDELLA
dialogue.text: Yeah.  I guess.

dialogue.speaker: MANDELLA
dialogue.text: You think?

dialogue.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogue.text: Oh yeah.

dialogue.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogue.text: Macbeth, right?

dialogue.speaker: MANDELLA
dialogue.text: Right.

dialogue.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogue.text: Kat a fan, too?

dialogue.speaker: MANDELLA
dialogue.text: Yeah...

dialogue.speaker: PATRICK
dialogue.text: Say it

dialogue.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: PATRICK
dialogue.text: Whatever the hell it is you're standin' there waitin' to say.

dialogue.speaker: PATRICK
dialogue.text: What plan?

dialogue.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogue.text: The situation is, my man Cameron here has a major jones for Bianca Stratford.

dialogue.speaker: PATRICK
dialogue.text: What is it with this chick?  She have three tits?

dialogue.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogue.text: I think I speak correctly when I say that Cameron's love is pure.  Purer than say -- Joey Dorsey's.

dialogue.speaker: PATRICK
dialogue.text: Dorsey can plow whoever he wants. I'm just in this for the cash.

dialogue.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogue.text: That's where we can help you.  With Kat.

dialogue.speaker: PATRICK
dialogue.text: So Dorsey can get the girl?

dialogue.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogue.text: Patrick, Pat, you're not looking at the big picture.  Joey's just a pawn. We set this whole thing up so Cameron can get the girl.

dialogue.speaker: PATRICK
dialogue.text: You two are gonna help me tame the wild beast?

dialogue.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogue.text: We're your guys.

dialogue.speaker: PATRICK
dialogue.text: What?!

dialogue.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogue.text: Good enough.

dialogue.speaker: PATRICK
dialogue.text: Are you telling me I'm a -  "non-smoker"?

dialogue.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogue.text: Just for now.

dialogue.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogue.text: Ever been to Club Skunk?

dialogue.speaker: PATRICK
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogue.text: I prefer to think of it simply as an alternative to what the law allows.

dialogue.speaker: PATRICK
dialogue.text: I'm likin' you guys better

dialogue.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogue.text: So you got cozy with she who stings?

dialogue.speaker: PATRICK
dialogue.text: No - I've got a sweet-payin' job that I'm about to lose.

dialogue.speaker: PATRICK
dialogue.text: You were right. She's still pissed.

dialogue.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogue.text: Sweet love, renew thy force!

dialogue.speaker: PATRICK
dialogue.text: Man -- don't say shit like that to  me. People can hear you.

dialogue.speaker: PATRICK
dialogue.text: I missed you.

dialogue.speaker: MISS PERKY
dialogue.text: It says here you exposed yourself to a group of freshmen girls.

dialogue.speaker: PATRICK
dialogue.text: It was a bratwurst.  I was eating lunch.

dialogue.speaker: MISS PERKY
dialogue.text: With the teeth of your zipper?

dialogue.speaker: MISS PERKY
dialogue.text: I don't understand, Patrick.  You haven't done anything asinine this week. Are you not feeling well?

dialogue.speaker: PATRICK
dialogue.text: Touch of the flu.

dialogue.speaker: MISS PERKY
dialogue.text: I'm at a loss, then.  What should we talk about? Your year of absence?

dialogue.speaker: MISS PERKY
dialogue.text: Why don't we discuss your driving need to be a hemorrhoid?

dialogue.speaker: PATRICK
dialogue.text: What's to discuss?

dialogue.speaker: MISS PERKY
dialogue.text: You weren't abused, you aren't stupid, and as far as I can tell, you're only slightly psychotic -- so why is it that you're such a fuck-up?

dialogue.speaker: PATRICK
dialogue.text: Well, you know -- there's the prestige of the job title... and the benefits package is pretty good...

dialogue.speaker: MISS PERKY
dialogue.text: You're completely demented.

dialogue.speaker: PATRICK
dialogue.text: See you next week!

dialogue.speaker: SHARON
dialogue.text: In the microwave.

dialogue.speaker: WALTER
dialogue.text: Make anyone cry today?

dialogue.speaker: SHARON
dialogue.text: What's a synonym for throbbing?

dialogue.speaker: WALTER
dialogue.text: Sarah Lawrence is on the other side of the country.

dialogue.speaker: WALTER
dialogue.text: Jesus!  Can a man even grab a sandwich before you women start dilating?

dialogue.speaker: SHARON
dialogue.text: Tumescent!

dialogue.speaker: WALTER
dialogue.text: You're not helping.

dialogue.speaker: SHARON
dialogue.text: Would you rather be ravished by a pirate or a British rear admiral?

dialogue.speaker: WALTER
dialogue.text: Pirate -- no question.

dialogue.speaker: SHARON
dialogue.text: They'll dance, they'll kiss, they'll come home.  Let her go.

dialogue.speaker: WALTER
dialogue.text: Kissing?  Is that what you think happens?  Kissing isn't what keeps me up to my elbows in placenta all day.

dialogue.speaker: WALTER
dialogue.text: What do you wanna watch?  We've got crap, crap, crap or crap

dialogue.speaker: SHARON
dialogue.text: Dr. Ruth?

dialogue.speaker: SHARON
dialogue.text: Have a great time, honey!

dialogue.speaker: WALTER
dialogue.text: But -- who -- what --?

dialogue.speaker: WALTER
dialogue.text: What just happened?

dialogue.speaker: SHARON
dialogue.text: Your daughters went to the prom.

dialogue.speaker: WALTER
dialogue.text: Did I have anything to say about it?

dialogue.speaker: SHARON
dialogue.text: Absolutely not.

dialogue.speaker: WALTER
dialogue.text: That ' s what I thought

dialogue.speaker: ALONSO
dialogue.text: I never seen heat like this!  Not even in Las Minas!

dialogue.speaker: SAILOR
dialogue.text: The water's going putrid in the barrels.

dialogue.speaker: ALONSO
dialogue.text: You'll be drinking your own piss... For the glory of Spain... and Admiral Colon...!  Bastard!

dialogue.speaker: ALONSO
dialogue.text: What are you listening to, chicken ass?

dialogue.speaker: SAILOR
dialogue.text: Ah, leave him alone.  He's doing no harm.

dialogue.speaker: ALONSO
dialogue.text: With a face like that?  I don't want you looking at me.  You hear?

dialogue.speaker: ALONSO
dialogue.text: He's the devil's child...

dialogue.speaker: SAILOR
dialogue.text: We'll all go crazy...

dialogue.speaker: ALONSO
dialogue.text: We should have seen land.

dialogue.speaker: SAILOR
dialogue.text: We left three weeks ago, Alonso. Can't be that near.

dialogue.speaker: ALONSO
dialogue.text: Can't be that far, I say.  Also, I don't like the smell of the sea around here.  Smells like a cunt. Bad sign...

dialogue.speaker: AROJAZ
dialogue.text: You say Asia can be found by sailing west?

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Yes, your Eminence.  The voyage should not take more than six or seven weeks.

dialogue.speaker: AROJAZ
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, Don Colon, that is precisely where our opinions differ...  Are you familiar with the work of Aristotle?  Erathostene?  Ptolemeus?

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: I am, Your Eminence

dialogue.speaker: AROJAZ
dialogue.text: Then you cannot ignore that according to their calculations, the circumference of the Earth is approximately...  22,000 leagues or more.  Which makes the ocean... uncrossable.

dialogue.speaker: AROJAZ
dialogue.text: Senor Colon, an experienced captain such as yourself will understand our concern with the crew.  I am not willing to have on my conscience the loss of men who would have relied upon our judgment.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Excellency, you are right.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Your Eminence, there is only one way to settle the matter.  And that is to make the journey.  I am ready to risk my life to prove it possible.

dialogue.speaker: AROJAZ
dialogue.text: Your life, and that of others!

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: If they agree to follow me, yes.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Trade, Your Excellency.  According to Marco Polo, the Kingdom of China is one of the richest of the world. Even the meanest buildings are roofed with gold.

dialogue.speaker: AROJAZ
dialogue.text: Is that all that interests you? Gold?

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: No.  The Portuguese have already discovered black-skinned people.  I, too, will find other populations -- and bring them to the word of God.

dialogue.speaker: AROJAZ
dialogue.text: If God intended our proximity to Asia, do you believe he would have waited for you to show it to the world?

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Did He not choose a carpenter's son to reveal Himself to the world?

dialogue.speaker: AROJAZ
dialogue.text: Don't you realize your words could be considered heretical?

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Blind faith is what I consider heresy!

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Asia can be found to the west -- and I will prove it.

dialogue.speaker: AROJAZ
dialogue.text: IF-GOD-WILLS-IT!

dialogue.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogue.text: The State has some reason to be interested in this man's proposition, Your Eminence...

dialogue.speaker: AROJAZ
dialogue.text: The Judgment is ours!

dialogue.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogue.text: Naturally.  But I would really deplore the loss of such a potential opportunity for Spain for a... dispute over a point of geography.

dialogue.speaker: AROJAZ
dialogue.text: He is a mercenary!  Did he not already try to convince the King of Portugal of his absurd notions?

dialogue.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogue.text: Indeed.  The world is full of mercenaries -- and states often make use of them, when it benefits them.  My only concern is the welfare and prosperity of Spain.

dialogue.speaker: AROJAZ
dialogue.text: It won't be easy to get rid of your prophet now, Don Sanchez.

dialogue.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogue.text: On the contrary, Your Eminence.  It seems to me the man is preparing his own cross.

dialogue.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogue.text: You can see for yourself.

dialogue.speaker: AROJAZ
dialogue.text: What a tragedy... what a waste of a life...

dialogue.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogue.text: A waste...?  Let me tell you something, Arojaz.  If your name, or mine, is ever remembered -- it will only be because of his.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: I could be gone for years.

dialogue.speaker: BEATRIX
dialogue.text: I know.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: I haven't given you much of a life.

dialogue.speaker: BEATRIX
dialogue.text: Well... that's true.  I have a child by a man who won't marry me!  Who's always leaving...

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Are we going to argue?

dialogue.speaker: BEATRIX
dialogue.text: I'd love to argue with you sometimes.  But you're never here!

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Perhaps I was never meant to live with a woman...

dialogue.speaker: BEATRIX
dialogue.text: I find that hard to believe.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: She said yes.

dialogue.speaker: BEATRIX
dialogue.text: Thank God...

dialogue.speaker: BEATRIX
dialogue.text: I'm not asking you to swear to anything.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: I don't want you to wait for me.

dialogue.speaker: BEATRIX
dialogue.text: That's something you can't decide.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Beatrix, I want to ask you something.

dialogue.speaker: BEATRIX
dialogue.text: You don't usually ask.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: I can arrange for the Queen to take Fernando and Diego into her service.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: God... you're so beautiful!  I can't believe no other man has ever taken you away from me...

dialogue.speaker: BEATRIX
dialogue.text: They tried... but I didn't let them.

dialogue.speaker: BEATRIX
dialogue.text: They took everything...

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Not everything... Do you think I care?  I'm a free man again.  Riches don't make a man rich, they only make him busier...

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Can't you stay with us a little?

dialogue.speaker: BEATRIX
dialogue.text: I am busy inside.

dialogue.speaker: BEATRIX
dialogue.text: What is it, now?  Tell me...

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: I can't keep my eyes off you.  I would like to catch up with all the moments I didn't spend with you.

dialogue.speaker: BOBADILLA
dialogue.text: I understand that you will soon be appointing Governors for the islands?  Is it not so?

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Don Bobadilla -- those positions have already been taken.

dialogue.speaker: BOBADILLA
dialogue.text: May I ask by whom?

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Bartolome and Giacomo Colon.

dialogue.speaker: BOBADILLA
dialogue.text: Don Alonso de Bobadilla.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Yes... I remember...

dialogue.speaker: BOBADILLA
dialogue.text: My letters of appointment.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Appointment to what?

dialogue.speaker: BOBADILLA
dialogue.text: Viceroy of the West Indies.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Congratulations.  Then I am free to search for the mainland.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: How far from here?

dialogue.speaker: BOBADILLA
dialogue.text: I am not a seaman.  But I heard it is no more than a week at sea.  I hope you are not too disappointed.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: How could I be?  The mainland has been found.  Exactly as I said it would.

dialogue.speaker: BOBADILLA
dialogue.text: I am afraid this is not the worst news.

dialogue.speaker: FERNANDO
dialogue.text: I want to go with you!

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: There'll be a time.

dialogue.speaker: FERNANDO
dialogue.text: You promise?  Do you swear on St. Christopher...?

dialogue.speaker: FERNANDO
dialogue.text: Do you swear on all the Holy Saints in heaven?

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Yes... Yes, I do... On all of them!

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: I have to explore the mainland.

dialogue.speaker: FERNANDO
dialogue.text: This time with me!

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: How are you feeling, Fernando?

dialogue.speaker: FERNANDO
dialogue.text: Not bad.

dialogue.speaker: FERNANDO
dialogue.text: Father...

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: There must be a passage to that other ocean.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: What are you listening to?

dialogue.speaker: FERNANDO
dialogue.text: I am not listening, Father.  But I can't help hearing.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: What does he say?

dialogue.speaker: FERNANDO
dialogue.text: He asks when he can come to visit you.  He left his address.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: He never had one... except aboard my ships!

dialogue.speaker: FERNANDO
dialogue.text: I want you to tell me everything you remember, Father.  From the beginning.  Everything.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Really?  God... I wouldn't know where to start... and yet...

dialogue.speaker: FERNANDO
dialogue.text: Tell me the first thing that comes to your mind.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: No...

dialogue.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogue.text: No?

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: NO...!  I have waited too long, fought too hard.  Now you expect me to take all the risks while you take the profit!  No... I will not be your servant!

dialogue.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogue.text: I remind you, Senor Colon, that you are in no position to bargain with me.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: I'm not bargaining!

dialogue.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogue.text: Then you are too ambitious.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: And were you never ambitious, Excellency?  Or is ambition only a virtue among the nobles, a fault for the rest of us?

dialogue.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogue.text: If you won't accept our proposal, we'll simply find someone who will.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: They don't see sin in their nakedness.  They live according to nature, in a never ending summer. The islands are covered with trees, filled with blossoms and fruits. And...

dialogue.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Don Colon.  But what about gold?

dialogue.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogue.text: You defend yourself admirably...

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: ... for a commoner?

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: But we do have a lack of notaries. You should contact my administration.

dialogue.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogue.text: Don Bobadilla is already a judge, my Dear Don Cristobal.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Good!  We are also in need of judges.  Except there are no thieves!

dialogue.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogue.text: You seem to have a special talent for making friends.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: What...?  Do I have so many already?

dialogue.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogue.text: To rise so high, in so short a time, is a dangerous occupation.  A little hypocrisy goes a long way.

dialogue.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogue.text: All I have to do is call the guards.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Call them.

dialogue.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogue.text: I am not afraid of you.  You are nothing but a dreamer.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Look out of that window.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: What do you see?

dialogue.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogue.text: Roofs... towers, palaces... spires...

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: All of them created by people like me.

dialogue.speaker: UTAPAN
dialogue.text: Say not here!  Cuba!

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: What is it?  A tribe?  An island?

dialogue.speaker: UTAPAN
dialogue.text: Island.  Far.

dialogue.speaker: UTAPAN
dialogue.text: You come!  You speak first!

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Tell the Chief we thank him.

dialogue.speaker: UTAPAN
dialogue.text: Chief knows.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Tell him his country is very beautiful.  Tell him we are leaving men here -- to build a fort.

dialogue.speaker: UTAPAN
dialogue.text: Chief says -- how many?

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Thousands.

dialogue.speaker: UTAPAN
dialogue.text: Why?

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: To bring the word of God.

dialogue.speaker: UTAPAN
dialogue.text: Chief says -- he has a God.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: ... and also to bring medicine.

dialogue.speaker: UTAPAN
dialogue.text: Chief says...

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: He has medicine.  Tell him we admire his people.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: We will work with his people.  We want peace.  Ask the Chief if he understands?

dialogue.speaker: UTAPAN
dialogue.text: He understands.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Ask him if he will help.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: You have to find them, Utapan.  Look what they did!

dialogue.speaker: UTAPAN
dialogue.text: You did the same to your God!

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Utapan, won't you speak to me?  You used to know how to speak to me.

dialogue.speaker: UTAPAN
dialogue.text: You never learned how to speak my language.

dialogue.speaker: MARCHENA
dialogue.text: Diego is a bright boy -- a pleasure to teach -- but so serious... Brothers should be raised together, Colon.  Even brothers from different mothers...

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Father, I am doing what I think is the best for him.  And he has the teacher I would have chosen for myself.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: God... That's in a week!

dialogue.speaker: MARCHENA
dialogue.text: That's what it says.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: How did you manage it?

dialogue.speaker: MARCHENA
dialogue.text: With some difficulty.  I had to promise them you were not a total fool.

dialogue.speaker: MARCHENA
dialogue.text: Why do you wish to sail west?

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: To open a new route to Asia.  At the moment there are only two ways of reaching it...

dialogue.speaker: MARCHENA
dialogue.text: How can you be so certain?  The Ocean is said to be infinite.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Ignorance!  I believe the Indies are no more than 750 leagues west of the Canary Islands.

dialogue.speaker: MARCHENA
dialogue.text: How can you be so certain?

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: The calculations of Toscanelli Marin de Tyr, Esdras...

dialogue.speaker: MARCHENA
dialogue.text: Esdras is a Jew.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: So was Christ!

dialogue.speaker: MARCHENA
dialogue.text: Two minutes... and already you're a dead man.  Don't let passion overwhelm you, Colon.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: I'll try to remember that, Marchena...

dialogue.speaker: MARCHENA
dialogue.text: Father Marchena!

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Passion is something one cannot control!

dialogue.speaker: MARCHENA
dialogue.text: You get so carried away when you are being contradicted!

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: I've been contradicted all my life... Eternity!

dialogue.speaker: MARCHENA
dialogue.text: Only God knows the meaning of such words, my son.

dialogue.speaker: MARCHENA
dialogue.text: You mustn't give way to despair. You must wait.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Wait!  I've waited seven years already!  How much longer do you want me to wait?

dialogue.speaker: MARCHENA
dialogue.text: If God intends you to go, then you will go.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Damn God!

dialogue.speaker: MARCHENA
dialogue.text: Colon!

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Damn all of you!  You all set up theories based on what?  You never leave the safety of your studies! Go out!  Find out what the world is about and then tell me something I can listen to!

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: All of them!  Just lies!

dialogue.speaker: MARCHENA
dialogue.text: Colon!  Don't!

dialogue.speaker: MARCHENA
dialogue.text: In Nomine Patris et Filius, et Spiritus Sancti.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Father.  For I have sinned.

dialogue.speaker: MARCHENA
dialogue.text: I am listening, my son.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Father, I have betrayed my family. I betrayed my men.  And I betrayed you.

dialogue.speaker: MARCHENA
dialogue.text: What are you saying?

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: I lied.  The journey will be longer than I said.

dialogue.speaker: MARCHENA
dialogue.text: How long?

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: I am not sure... It could be twice the distance.

dialogue.speaker: MARCHENA
dialogue.text: May God forgive you...!  You must tell them!  You must tell your men!

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: If I tell them, they won't follow me.  You know that I am right, Father.  You trust me...

dialogue.speaker: MARCHENA
dialogue.text: My son, my son...  Your certitudes are sometimes frightening...  Christopher, you must speak to them. And if you don't I will.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: You are bound by an oath, Father.

dialogue.speaker: MARCHENA
dialogue.text: I believed in you...

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Give me absolution.

dialogue.speaker: MARCHENA
dialogue.text: I suppose we're both old men now.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: You'll always be older than me, Father.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: I have to disagree.

dialogue.speaker: MARCHENA
dialogue.text: I knew you would.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: New worlds create new people.

dialogue.speaker: MARCHENA
dialogue.text: Oh?  So you are a new man?

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: I don't know... I have the impression that I didn't change that much.  I still can't accept the world as it is!

dialogue.speaker: ISABEL
dialogue.text: I should not even be listening to you, since my council said no.  But Santangel tells me you are a man of honor and sincerity... And Sanchez, that you are not a fool.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: No more than the woman who said she would take Granada from the Moors.

dialogue.speaker: ISABEL
dialogue.text: The ocean is uncrossable?

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: What did they say about Granada before today?

dialogue.speaker: ISABEL
dialogue.text: That she was impregnable.

dialogue.speaker: ISABEL
dialogue.text: I cannot ignore the verdict of my council.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Surely you can do anything you want.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: May I speak freely?

dialogue.speaker: ISABEL
dialogue.text: You show no inclination to speak otherwise!

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: I know what I see.  I see someone who doesn't accept the world as it is.  Who's not afraid.  I see a women who thinks... "What if?"...

dialogue.speaker: ISABEL
dialogue.text: A woman?

dialogue.speaker: ISABEL
dialogue.text: How old are you, Senor Colon?

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Thirty seven, Your Majesty... And you?

dialogue.speaker: ISABEL
dialogue.text: Do they have such thoughts?

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: They come and go as naked as the day God created them...

dialogue.speaker: ISABEL
dialogue.text: But without your brothers.  Nor are you to return to Santo Domingo or any of the other colonies.  You may explore the continent.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: ISABEL
dialogue.text: There is one thing I'd like to understand... Why do you want to go back, after all this?

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Your Majesty -- some men are content to read about things.  I must see them with my own eyes.  I cannot be other than I am.

dialogue.speaker: MOXICA
dialogue.text: And you say this is an Indian vice? By God!  I don't see any kind of pleasure that would make this a sin.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: The Indians have no such word, Don Moxica.

dialogue.speaker: MOXICA
dialogue.text: We lost cousins, friends.  We will wash this in blood.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: If you want to keep your head on your shoulders, you'll do as I say.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: You want a war?  Fine.  We are a thousand.  They outnumber us by ten! Who will you kill?  Which tribe?

dialogue.speaker: MOXICA
dialogue.text: We don't need to know.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: We came here to stay!  To build! Not to start a crusade.  In this forest, there is enough danger to sweep us away in days!  So we will be brave and swallow our grief.  And in the name of those who died, we will accomplish what we came for.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: We can't raise the wheel without it.

dialogue.speaker: MOXICA
dialogue.text: My horse doesn't work.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Don Moxica -- we all have to work.

dialogue.speaker: MOXICA
dialogue.text: You did not hear me, Don Colon.  Not my horse.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: In one act of brutality, you have created chaos.  Tribes who were fighting each other are now joining forces against us!  All that because of your criminal savagery!

dialogue.speaker: MOXICA
dialogue.text: Savagery is what monkeys understand.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: You'll be held in detention, deprived of your privileges and possessions.  Until you are returned to Spain where you will be judged. Have you anything to say?

dialogue.speaker: MOXICA
dialogue.text: You will regret this.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Due west, Captain Mendez.  And may God be with us...

dialogue.speaker: MENDEZ
dialogue.text: God be with us admiral.

dialogue.speaker: MENDEZ
dialogue.text: Well... It's the men, Sir.  They wonder how you know our position. We've lost sight from land days ago...

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: And what do you think Mendez?

dialogue.speaker: MENDEZ
dialogue.text: Well, I surely know what a quadrant is!  But I've never seen it used at night before.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Come over here.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: What do you read?

dialogue.speaker: MENDEZ
dialogue.text: Twenty eight.

dialogue.speaker: MENDEZ
dialogue.text: What's he doing?

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: He's drawing an isthmus... He's saying we're on an isthmus.

dialogue.speaker: MENDEZ
dialogue.text: We can't be.

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Where can I meet this man?

dialogue.speaker: PINZON
dialogue.text: Immediately.

dialogue.speaker: PINZON
dialogue.text: You lied!  You cheated!  We're way past 750 leagues!

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Six days ago, yes.

dialogue.speaker: PINZON
dialogue.text: You must be mad...!

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: We have to keep the hopes of these men alive!

dialogue.speaker: PINZON
dialogue.text: We're on the verge of a mutiny, Colon!

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: You think I don't know that?

dialogue.speaker: PINZON
dialogue.text: We're lost!

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: The land is there.  I know it!

dialogue.speaker: PINZON
dialogue.text: You don't know anything!  Listen Colon, these are my ships, right? So I'm telling you we're turning back!

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: And then what?  Half of the water has gone, the rest is nearly putrid! You know that!

dialogue.speaker: PINZON
dialogue.text: Jesus Maria!  I should have never listened to you!

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: You never did.  You did all the talking for both of us, remember?

dialogue.speaker: PINZON
dialogue.text: You bloody...

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: Pinzon, Pinzon... All we can do now is go forward!  Think about that!

dialogue.speaker: PINZON
dialogue.text: You tell that to them!

dialogue.speaker: COLUMBUS
dialogue.text: You're right.  Let the men decide.

dialogue.speaker: ISABEL
dialogue.text: Is that the man I knew, Treasurer Sanchez?

dialogue.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogue.text: Yes, Your Majesty.

dialogue.speaker: ISABEL
dialogue.text: You were right, Don Sanchez... His demands could never be granted.

dialogue.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogue.text: Never, Your Majesty.  Although...

dialogue.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogue.text: ... Into a monk...

dialogue.speaker: ISABEL
dialogue.text: Yes.  It would be a pity, wouldn't it?  Call him back!

dialogue.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogue.text: Every ship returns with a cargo of sick and dying.  But with no gold! The new world proves expensive, Your Majesty.

dialogue.speaker: ISABEL
dialogue.text: We weren't expecting immediate profits, were we?  We must have faith.  We must give time for time.

dialogue.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogue.text: ... But there is worse.  He ordered the execution of five members of the nobility...

dialogue.speaker: ISABEL
dialogue.text: Is this true, Brother Buyl?

dialogue.speaker: ISABEL
dialogue.text: Then, what do you suggest, Don Sanchez?

dialogue.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogue.text: He must be replaced.

dialogue.speaker: ISABEL
dialogue.text: And who would you think of, for such a task?

dialogue.speaker: ISABEL
dialogue.text: I know, I should not tolerate his impertinence.

dialogue.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogue.text: Then why?

dialogue.speaker: ISABEL
dialogue.text: Because he is not afraid of me.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Are you my attorney?  I'm Emil.  I'm insane.

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: I'm not your lawyer until I see the money.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Here.  I have your money.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Oh no!  No!  Shit!

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: Emil.  Take it easy.  Stay with me.  Sit down.  What do you need?  What are you looking for?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: He has the camera!  He took the movie!

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: Don't say anything.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Where are we going?

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: I'm coming with you.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Yes.  Yes, come with me!

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: I'm invoking rights - this man is represented by counsel.  I'm coming with him.

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: I brought you some letters.  It's really fan mail.  Women mostly.  One wants to buy you clothes, another sent a check. Another wants a check.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: You bring the cigarettes?

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: Oh, sure.

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: ...delusions and paranoia.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: I was all of these.

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: Well, you didn't appreciate the severity of it until recently.  No question about that.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: What about Oleg?

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: Disappeared.  They're looking everywhere.  Maybe he went back to Czechoslovakia.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: No, he is here.  Shit...

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: Don't worry about him.  Think about yourself.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: What about my movie rights?  Book rights?

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: Look, I haven't really focused on that kind of thing.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: What's your cut?  How much?

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: I would say...half.  Half is fair.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: No.  No way.

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: But it's...

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Thirty-percent.  No more.  Or I call another lawyer.  This is the biggest case of your life.  Don't try to negotiate.  Thirty percent.  Say yes or no.

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: This is not about money, Emil.  I need your trust in me.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: What else do you need?

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: I need to know about your background.  I need to know about your upbringing.  Why you're here.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Give me another one, please.

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: Tell me about yourself.  What you did as a young boy... what your parents were like.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: My father always degraded me.  Killed my self-esteem.  And my mother was blind.

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: Your mother was blind?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Yeah, she went blind giving birth to me. She went to fucking black market doctor to induce me.

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: Back in the Czech Republic?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah...bad doctor gave her bad drugs which made her go blind.  And my father blamed me for her blindness...

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: Your father blamed you for your mother's blindness?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Yeah, he hated me from day when I was born.  Put it out.  Can you put the cigarette out?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: That's what he did to me.  He put cigarettes out on me.

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: Your father put cigarettes out on you?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Out on my back when I was a small boy.

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: Can I see your back?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: I'm abused.  Don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: I don't think it's abuse, I think it's torture.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: ...so we kill someone famous and if we are caught, we are sent to mental hospital...

dialogue.speaker: CUTLER
dialogue.text: Officers, there's your killer, do your duty, arrest him!

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: ...my little sister and I shared a flat - I came home one night and a man was raping her.  His gun was on the chair... He came at me and I shot him.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Alright.  That's a justifiable homicide.

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: Yes, but he was a cop.

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: Now I become custody of police department?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: If you cooperate with the DA - maybe they'll help you with your situation.

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: I will if they don't send me back.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: They won't until this is over.

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: Are you married?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Divorced.

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: Do you live alone?  I've been in these clothes since...the killings.  Could we stop at your place? I could take a shower...before I go into custody?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: I can't take you to my place.

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: Somewhere else?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: The men are out of quarters - practicing putting out fires.

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: So...the station is empty?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Yeah.  This way.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: You considered becoming a prostitute?

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: Yes, I considered it.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Did you ever turn tricks before?

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: What about back home?

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: I came here.  I had no money.  I knew no one.  I couldn't get a job because you have to have a green card to get work. They approached me - I could've made a lot of money.  I considered it, but... it's not who I am.  They pay me below the table at Ludwig's.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: So you were never a prostitute?

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: What are you asking me?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: I'm just trying to find out who you are.

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: I'm not a whore.  I'm not a whore.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: I know.

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: You don't know.  I'm sorry.  I was desperate.  That's not me.  I shot a cop.  Can you imagine what they'll do to me when I got to prison?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: They're not gonna send you right back.

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: I'm sorry.  I didn't mean to...I'm glad. Actually I'm glad it's over.  All this time.  Hiding.  Never being able to look anyone in the eyes. Always afraid that someone would find out who I was.  Never trusting anyone...

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: Are you alright?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: I still can't believe Eddie's gone.

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: I'm sorry.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Is he your boyfriend?

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: Ludwig?  He's gay - are you jealous?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: If I was your boyfriend, I might be.

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: If you were my boyfriend, I'd suggest you find another girlfriend that isn't going to jail ten-thousand miles away.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: A good Immigration lawyer could stall the process.  Eddie recommended one.

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: No matter what happens...I'm glad I met you.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: I'm glad I met you.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: You better get packed.

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: Right.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Do you have coffee?

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: In the kitchen.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: I'll make some for us.

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: I'll get my clothes.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: What are you doing?

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: Pouring it out!

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: Forget about me.  You have enough problems of your own.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: ...Do you really want me to forget about you?

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: I don't want to drag you down with me.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Daphne, I...

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: I told your partner, I can't help.  I didn't see anything.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: C'mon, start at the beginning.  You know these people?

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: Tamina was a friend of mine.  My shower was broken, she let me use theirs.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Go on.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Whether you tell us or not, we'll find out.  Better if it comes from you.

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: If I tell you, will you arrest me?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Arrest you for what?  Why would we arrest you?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Are you here illegally?  Don't worry about that.  We'll talk to Immigration. They won't deport you.

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: No, no, don't talk to Immigration!

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: A cop?

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: I'm from a small town in Slovakia.  Like the South here.  The Police is right, a civilian is wrong.  So I fled.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Look, we can help you but right now we have to deal with what's happening here. Tell us the truth...is that the truth?

dialogue.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogue.text: You're a cop - you'll never believe me.

dialogue.speaker: DUFFY
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: It was my decision, not his.

dialogue.speaker: DUFFY
dialogue.text: Well, I'm the Deputy Chief Fire Marshall and every now and then I'd like to be included in decisions.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Look, after Jordy briefs me, you can do the press conference.  How about that? The case is all yours.

dialogue.speaker: DUFFY
dialogue.text: Oh yeah...?  Alright.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: I'm ready to be briefed.  Excuse us.

dialogue.speaker: DUFFY
dialogue.text: Yeah, sure.  Beep me when you're ready for the press conference.

dialogue.speaker: DUFFY
dialogue.text: Who did cause and origin?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Who do you think, Chief?!

dialogue.speaker: DUFFY
dialogue.text: Then why didn't you talk to the reporter?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: 'Cause we got more important things to do, like finding out who did it.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Hey, Chief, what are you doing here?

dialogue.speaker: DUFFY
dialogue.text: I came to see how the investigation was going.  I called and you're not here.  I wait up at the station and you don't even show up!!!  I beep you - you don't return my call.  Where the hell have you been?!

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Ladder 20 was on the Rock for training. We stopped there... so she could get cleaned up.

dialogue.speaker: DUFFY
dialogue.text: What do you mean, 'cleaned up?'

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: I let her take a shower.

dialogue.speaker: DUFFY
dialogue.text: A shower!?  Did you take one, too?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: No!  Nothing happened.

dialogue.speaker: DUFFY
dialogue.text: Oh really.  That's nice.  You took a homicide witness to take a shower after your partner was shot?  Are you out of your fucking mind??  Are you having that much trouble gettin' dates?!

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Chief - mind if I take her?

dialogue.speaker: DUFFY
dialogue.text: Okay.  But not water sports.

dialogue.speaker: DUFFY
dialogue.text: The public doesn't have any idea what we do and now you're going to define our image!  This is going to be our Rodney King!

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: What was I supposed to do?  The guy tried to mug me.  I was gonna send a cop back - I just forgot.

dialogue.speaker: DUFFY
dialogue.text: Forgot?  You handcuffed a civilian to a tree?!

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Chief - I know I screwed up - but this guy was no innocent civilian.

dialogue.speaker: DUFFY
dialogue.text: Well this is gonna end your career and probably mine.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: End my career?

dialogue.speaker: DUFFY
dialogue.text: How are you going to fight this?  Maybe if Oleg hadn't gotten away and you'd been on the front page, as a hero, this thing would be easier to fight.  You'd have the good to weight against the bad! It's unfortunate that I have to make decisions based upon your press coverage but there's nothing I can do!  Gimme your shield.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: But Chief?  Over this??

dialogue.speaker: DUFFY
dialogue.text: There's nothing to talk about.  Get a good lawyer.  You're suspended until your trial.

dialogue.speaker: DUFFY
dialogue.text: Don't you guys understand?  It's all about image.  The better we look the more money I get to pay you guys overtime.

dialogue.speaker: KORFIN
dialogue.text: Yeah, right.

dialogue.speaker: DUFFY
dialogue.text: What was that, Korfin?

dialogue.speaker: KORFIN
dialogue.text: I said, yeah, you're right, Chief.  As soon as we get somethin' we'll let you alert the media.

dialogue.speaker: DUFFY
dialogue.text: You do that, wiseguy.  Now let's solve this thing before Eddie Flemming does.

dialogue.speaker: DUFFY
dialogue.text: Did the D.A. videotape her deposition?

dialogue.speaker: KORFIN
dialogue.text: Yeah.  He finished awhile ago.

dialogue.speaker: DUFFY
dialogue.text: Alright.  Swing by her apartment.  Let her pick up her clothes and take her straight to Hoover Street.  You got that?

dialogue.speaker: KORFIN
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: LEON
dialogue.text: Coffee for me, I gotta slow down.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Vodka tonic.

dialogue.speaker: LEON
dialogue.text: Maybe you could just put in a shot of Martell?

dialogue.speaker: LEON
dialogue.text: It was freaky, I'll tell you.  Stupid kid.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: What's the kid gonna say - sorry? Meanwhile I'm not here anymore. Like last week - we were at the morgue and this guy was all chopped up - spleen here - liver there - his heart in a pan. Six hours ago this guy was walkin' his dog or buyin' a quart of milk.  Who knows?  But some kid's robbed him for $3 or some shit and shot him and now you can't tell if he's a piece of beef or a human being and I'm thinkin' that's me. Sooner or later.  That's me.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: I'm gonna propose.

dialogue.speaker: LEON
dialogue.text: When?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Tomorrow.  At lunch.

dialogue.speaker: LEON
dialogue.text: You ready?

dialogue.speaker: LEON
dialogue.text: What's he looking for?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: A timer.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Where is she?

dialogue.speaker: LEON
dialogue.text: Takin' a bath.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Any I.D.?

dialogue.speaker: LEON
dialogue.text: Still unknown but we're running prints. Kid over there caught the case.

dialogue.speaker: LEON
dialogue.text: Sorry...PD only.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: It's okay.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Only one guys checked in?

dialogue.speaker: LEON
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: C'mere.  You wanna go to homicide school?  Here - make yourself useful.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: The other side of the street.  The guy with the videocamera.  Don't look - put her in the car.  Stay this side.

dialogue.speaker: LEON
dialogue.text: Stay with her.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Are you hit?

dialogue.speaker: LEON
dialogue.text: No.  I'm okay.

dialogue.speaker: LEON
dialogue.text: He got my gun!  Motherfucker was filming the whole time!

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: I know.  Relax.  Take it easy.  Don't worry, we'll get those fuckers.

dialogue.speaker: ROSE
dialogue.text: Who's there?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Police.  We'd like to ask you a few questions.

dialogue.speaker: ROSE
dialogue.text: I have nothin' to say.  If you wanna contact my attorney...

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Homicide, Miss Hearn.  It's Detective Eddie Flemming.  Open up.

dialogue.speaker: ROSE
dialogue.text: What's wrong?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: We don't have her I.D. yet, but one of your girls was killed last night at the King Edward Hotel.

dialogue.speaker: ROSE
dialogue.text: Oh my G-d.  Honey!  Honey's dead?

dialogue.speaker: ROSE
dialogue.text: Yeah.  He wanted a girl from Czechoslovakia, but I sent him Honey 'cause once they get there, you know, it doesn't really matter - Honey was killed...?  Poor girl...

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Do you have any Czech girls working for you?

dialogue.speaker: ROSE
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Did you tell him you did?

dialogue.speaker: ROSE
dialogue.text: Boy, she's so popular all the sudden.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: What are you saying?

dialogue.speaker: ROSE
dialogue.text: Daphne.  Another guy came in asking me about her, too.

dialogue.speaker: ROSE
dialogue.text: He said he was her cousin.  I told him where she works.  They were just here.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Describe him.

dialogue.speaker: ROSE
dialogue.text: Tall, short-haired, scary eyes.  Second guy with him was...shorter, with a wrestler's build.  And he wouldn't turn his videocamera off me.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: He had a videocamera?  Where is she? Quickly!

dialogue.speaker: ROSE
dialogue.text: She washes hair up at Ludwig's - a salon on 63rd and Madison.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Hey, that's great you guys got it all wrapped up, but you don't mind if we go through the routine?  It gives us somethin' to do.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: No, we don't mind.  You mind Leon?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: You know what that is, right?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: No, what is it?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Why don't you explain it, Bobby.  Hey Camello!  You mind punching a hole in the floor?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: It's your crime scene now.  You can do what you want.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Watch the news?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Nah, I musta missed it.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Well, just so you know.  I gave you guys the credit.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Well, just so you know, I don't care about that stuff.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Nah, why should you?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: I don't even watch TV.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Good.  Good.  Commendable.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Did you get a report from the M.E.?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Sure.  But I would like to ask you something.  You got a problem with me?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: If you found me steppin' on your crime scene - it might piss you off, too.  What about the report?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: You were right, they were both dead before the fire.  The male was stabbed so hard the killer broke off the tip of the knife in his spine.  That's usually an indicator of something personal.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: The Super said he'd seen her before but she didn't live here.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Pretty.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Hmmmm.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Maybe you don't care about that either.  Prettiest suspect I've had in awhile.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Who says she's a suspect?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: What would you call her?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Look, I'm not even sure she has anything to do with this.  I saw her outside after the fire - thought it was a lead. Maybe she saw something.  Maybe she was visiting somebody here.  Who knows?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Maybe it's a ritual thing or someone trying to send a message.  Burial rites are taken very seriously in Eastern Europe.  It could be to humiliate them. Just burning them up, no proper funeral, it's like condemning them to hell.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Eastern Europe.  Like what?  Romania? Hungary?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Or Czechoslovakia.  The Slavs have been fighting the Germans and the Russians for a thousand years.  These are very intense people and they take things personally.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: I'll come with you.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: There wasn't a fire.  There'll be nothing for you to do.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: I can watch you, Eddie.  Maybe I'll learn something.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: This isn't homicide school.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: My parents are from Poland.  I can help with the Eastern European angle.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: You're Polish?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: My folks are.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Stay here.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: You goin' to the escort service?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: You got any better ideas?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Mind if I ride along with you?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: This has nothing to do with your fire.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: But what if it does?  You might need my help.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: I'll let you know what happens.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: This is ridiculous.  I'm not gonna be in your way - we can talk the case over.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Tell you what - I'll flip you a coin. If you win you can come with me.  If you don't win, you don't come.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: I'll call it... tails.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Two heads.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Better than one.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Leon - meet us at 63rd and Madison. Hair salon.  Ludwig's.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: I'm on my way with Eddie.  Ludwig's. 63rd and Madison.  The suspects might be there already.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: You thirsty?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: I'm on duty.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: So am I.  Alright, I'll go inside and you cover the back.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Of course.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Hey!  I always wanted to be a cop when I was a kid.  I dreamed of running up to a door, kicking it in, pulling my gun and yelling 'Freeze!' at the bad guy! What'd you dream about?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: I wanted to run up to a building on fire, kick in the door, rush into the smoke and save a kid.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Then I guess we're doin' this the right way, aren't we?  If we pull up to a burning building I'll gladly let you go first.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: What are you hiding?  Why are you afraid

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: She just saw two of her friends killed! They probably threatened her.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Is that all there is?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Why not?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Something back home?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: She's fucked.  Even if that story is true.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Raw deal.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Look - let me talk to her.  Any leads I get, they're all yours.  Just let me have a first crack at her.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: You wanna talk to her alone?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: What would your girlfriend think of that?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: I don't have a girlfriend.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: My point exactly.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: I'm serious here.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: So am I.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: C'mon.  You intimidate her 'cause you're a celebrity.  She sees me differently.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: You're her Savior?  Is she the kid you're gonna save from the burning building?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: You know what I'm saying here.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Okay, tell you what, I'll give you a head start.  You take her to the station house.  Don't let her out of your sight. She's the only warm body we got left.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Hey.  I'm a professional.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Women like that have a way of turning professionals into amateurs.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Look, Eddie, I'm tellin' you - I didn't touch her.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Well, you shoulda because nobody's gonna believe you didn't...including me.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: I took her there for a shower and that's it.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Just a shower?

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Yeah, just her in the shower.  Nothing happened.  Look, I'm sure you probably think I'm a fool and I fucked up, but...

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: No, I don't think you were a fool, I just think you were stupid about it.  I mean, to say the least, you outta know better.  You don't know her well enough. She's got the potential to fucking hang you even if she suggests that you made a pass at her, it's fuckin' over.  You can deny it all you want, but it will not make one fucking bit of difference. You're dead.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: I told you, you know, I thought I was doing the right thing, you know, I think she's innocent.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Well, it's not up to you to decide whether she's innocent or not.  Don't you understand, that's why you're a professional.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: But, I mean, didn't you ever go out on a limb for somebody?  I mean, you shoulda heard her there.  Tellin' her whole story...I believed her.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: How you go out on a limb for somebody is by giving her a number of an Immigration lawyer.  Here, here's a number of an Immigration lawyer.  That's how you help her. But you can't get involved in her like that.  You're gonna jeopardize your career, your life and you're gonna jeopardize my case.  And lemme give you another piece of advice.  Maybe you don't watch TV but I'll let you in on a little secret - the whole fuckin' world watches television.  And when you get out there, they know your face.  And the little fame, the little fuckin' itty bitty fame that I get in this city makes it a lot easier for my job.  And I get more done because of it.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Why'd you help me back there with the Chief?  Why'd you stand up for me like that?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: You know, I don't know.  I like you. You remind me of a puppy I used to have. He pissed on the rug all the time, but I still kept him.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: So...who's Nicky?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: What do you want?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Your opinion.  You see, they going to make a movie about me, too, Eddie.  And write books.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: What's your accomplishment.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: I kill someone famous.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Then do it, asshole.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Good - be tough to the end.  Actor who plays you will want to die like hero.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: So tabloids don't have to do re enactments.  They going to have real movie this time.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: If you kill me and film it you're putting a noose around your neck.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: You really think you'll be able to fool a jury with this bullshit?  How fuckin' stupid are you?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Smarter than Americans.  You're fed cry baby talk shows all day long.  Not only will Americans believe me, they'll cry for me.  So...Detective Eddie Flemming, would you like to say goodbye to your Nicolette? Maybe you can propose to her now?

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Detective, does it look like a murder?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: We don't know that yet.  It's much too early.  There's a lot to be done.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: How many victims are up there?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: There are two bodies found at this point.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Can we go up to the crime scene?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: You know you can't do that.  C'mon.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Is it drug related?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: We don't know.  When I have more I'll let you know.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Detective - can you tell us what happened here?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: I can't talk right now.  We have some things to take care of.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: I understand, but I noticed that the Fire Marshall is here with you.  Is this somehow related to the fire department?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: I really can't give out any information right now at this point.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Okay.  But I do understand that your partner, Leon Jackson's been injured. Is that correct?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: He was hurt, but not seriously.  He'll be fine.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Do you have the suspect in custody?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Um...now is not a good time, okay. Detective Jackson's hurt.  He's fine. I've got a Fire Marshall shot, Detective Jackson is hurt but not seriously.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Alright, cut, cut, cut.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Eddie, are you okay?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Yeah.  Now's not a good time.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Alright.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Alright?

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Alright.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Alright.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Hey, honey.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: What is your problem?  Why'd you snap at me?  I just wanted a statement.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: I can't...I can't answer you just because you want me to answer you!

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: You didn't have to embarrass me in front of my colleagues.  You could give me something.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Oh, I'm sorry.  Did I embarrass you, sweetheart?  Oh...

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Stop it.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Maybe I should just, ya know...turn to the cameras and say, do you mind if we just work something out?

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Alright, alright, Eddie.  Don't patronize me.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: I'm not.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Yes you are.  I'm not just some reporter.  I don't just stick a microphone in your face.  You could give me something.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Yeah, well you took the camera and put it right down on the evidence.  That was...

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: That was good.  You were holding the evidence.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: You were merciless.  You didn't give a shit if you got me or not.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Well, who was it that taught me how to do that?  Huh?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: You're ruthless.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: You're not so bad yourself.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Look at this.  You have blood on your shirt.  Whose is it?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Could be Leon's.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Jesus.  And last week you came over with blood on your shoes.  What am I going to do with you?

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Don't worry about the damn phone.  I won't answer it.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Answer the phone.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: No.  Tell me what you want to say.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Answer it.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Okay.  Okay.  Hold that thought just for a second.  They only call me when it's an emergency.  Just hold that thought.  Can you call back?

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Oh my G-d, they want me to anchor.  They want me to anchor tonight!

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: That's good.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Well, that's great.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Okay.  That is great.  But I can't go now, we're in the middle of something here.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: No.  Go ahead.  You're gonna be great.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: No.  No, listen to me here.  I want to know what you're talking about.  You know, the shoe thing and the marriages and...

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: I'll tell you tonight.  Let's do it tonight.  As soon as you get back we'll talk.  We'll talk.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Promise?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: I promise.  We'll talk.  You'll be great.  You'll be fine.  Go ahead, just imagine that, uh... Just look into the lens and imagine you're talking to me.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Yeah.  I'll do that.  As long as you're not patronizing me.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Patronizing you... Nay, I love you.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: I love you.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Okay, til tonight.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Tonight.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: You promise?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Yeah.  I promise.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Okay.  And you know what, I'll swing by my place, grab a couple pairs of shoes and maybe just test them out next to yours...How's that... Would that be a good thing.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah.  Good thing.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: See you later.  Good luck.

dialogue.speaker: NICOLETTE
dialogue.text: Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Don't be late.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: So we're waitin' to hit this warrant - we got Emergency Service with the heavy weapons standin' by - ready to go.  I say, lemme get a cigar outta the car.  I go to get the cigar and BOOM!  All the sudden I turn around and a kid with a shotgun let one go.  Right where I was standin'.  That coulda been it.  I coulda had my head blown off and for what?  Some stupid kid got panicky, takes the safety off and it's over.  If I hadn't gone back for that cigar - for a bad habit - I would've had my head blown off.

dialogue.speaker: HAWKINS
dialogue.text: Jesus Christ.

dialogue.speaker: HAWKINS
dialogue.text: Sooner or later that's everybody.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Not chopped up.  Not chopped up like that.  I mean, what do I got left? Coupla articles.  A medal or two. Plaque here and there and in a coupla years no one remembers me anymore.

dialogue.speaker: HAWKINS
dialogue.text: I think you're getting a little moody there, Eddie.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: I'm not moody.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: How old are your kids?

dialogue.speaker: HAWKINS
dialogue.text: My kids?  Let's see...Susan's 15. Aundrea's 9.  Don't tell me you're thinking about having a kid!  How old are you?  Never mind. Let me just tell you this: Every stupid cliche you hear about kids - they change your life, they make you a better person, they make you whole...  It's all true!  Before I had kids when friends talked about their kids, I wanted to vomit.  Now -- I get it.  Am I right, Leon?

dialogue.speaker: HAWKINS
dialogue.text: So what's unique?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Not what.  Who.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: He's from Antigua.  His girlfriend was taking too long to put her make-up on. they were late for a party.  Stabbed her with a beer bottle.

dialogue.speaker: HAWKINS
dialogue.text: That's unique.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Yeah.  And he still went to the party.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: I hope this prick doesn't run.  My knees are killing me.  Stay behind me.

dialogue.speaker: HAWKINS
dialogue.text: You're worried for my safety.  I'm touched.

dialogue.speaker: HAWKINS
dialogue.text: Ready?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Keep them out of my way.

dialogue.speaker: HAWKINS
dialogue.text: Okay.  You ready?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah.  Jesus.

dialogue.speaker: HAWKINS
dialogue.text: Any chance we can do that again?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Again?  I didn't wanna do it the first time.

dialogue.speaker: SECONDARY OFFICER
dialogue.text: Okay.  You work in a vodka factory.  I understand that.  And what kind of work do you do?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: I am butcher.

dialogue.speaker: SECONDARY OFFICER
dialogue.text: You're a butcher?  What do you use pig intestines for?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: You stuff sausage in it.

dialogue.speaker: SECONDARY OFFICER
dialogue.text: And what do you do with the bones?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Dog food.

dialogue.speaker: SECONDARY OFFICER
dialogue.text: Are you married?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: No.  Are you proposing?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Come to 45 Broadway.  Don't bring the Police.  Come alone or you'll be in my next film.

dialogue.speaker: HAWKINS
dialogue.text: Look asshole.  I've been threatened by better than you.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: No.  I'm the best that's ever threatened you.

dialogue.speaker: HAWKINS
dialogue.text: I'll meet you on one condition - I get exclusivity and you surrender to me.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: We'll talk about that.  Four o'clock gives you time to go to bank.  Three hundred thousand dollars.

dialogue.speaker: HAWKINS
dialogue.text: What?  It doesn't work that way.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: If you don't want my film - I'll call another show.  And they will show it.

dialogue.speaker: HAWKINS
dialogue.text: Wait a minute.  Wait a minute.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Come alone.  Bring cash.  And we'll talk about surrendering.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Were you a fireman?  That how you knew how to rig the apartment?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: My father was.  He gave me many lessons about fire.  Now it's my friend.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Tommy, take a walk.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: You can't kill me.  You're not a cop. Just fireman with a gun.  I bet you never shot anybody in your life.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: You'll be my first.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: C'mon.  Pull the trigger.  Do it.  Oh, look, you're sweating.  You don't have the balls.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Get down on your knees.

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Where's your partner?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: The Sheraton!  On Broadway!  Room 210. Go get Oleg.  He'll kill you.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Tell him to put his gun down!

dialogue.speaker: JORDY
dialogue.text: Let her go!  Let her go!!

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: If he doesn't lower his gun I'll fucking kill her.

dialogue.speaker: HONEY
dialogue.text: Hi, I'm Honey.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Where's Czech girl?

dialogue.speaker: HONEY
dialogue.text: Baby, I'm anybody you want me to be. I'm a little schoolgirl, I'm mommy, I'm a Czech girl.

dialogue.speaker: HONEY
dialogue.text: Now I like to get business out of the way before we get down to pleasure.  Why don'tchya put my money on the dresser.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: I ordered a Czech girl.  Daphne, you know her?

dialogue.speaker: HONEY
dialogue.text: It's an outcall service run out of an apartment.  I don't meet the other girls.  Aren't you gonna get undressed?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Where is escort service?

dialogue.speaker: HONEY
dialogue.text: That's confidential.  Could you put the money on the dresser?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: I like to talk to the person who runs the service.  Can you give me address?

dialogue.speaker: HONEY
dialogue.text: Look.  Do we have a problem here? There's no reason to have a problem. I'm gonna make you feel real good.  You wanna Czech girl? After I'm done with you, you won't miss her.  Now why don't you pay me?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Listen to me.  I don't want sex.  Just give me the address and then you go.

dialogue.speaker: HONEY
dialogue.text: Look, man, I don't give a shit if you want sex or not, but you're payin' for my time.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Give me the address!!

dialogue.speaker: HONEY
dialogue.text: Alright, alright - don't hurt me! Please, it's in my book, in my purse!

dialogue.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
dialogue.text: Next.  Could I see your documents, please?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Yes sir.

dialogue.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
dialogue.text: What is your intended purpose of your visit to the United States?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Two weeks holiday.

dialogue.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
dialogue.text: How much money are you carrying with you?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: I have five-hundred dollars.

dialogue.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
dialogue.text: Can you show me?  Sir, no cameras in the FIS area!

dialogue.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
dialogue.text: Is he with you?  Are you travelling together?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Yes.

dialogue.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
dialogue.text: Please join us.  Come on forward.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Is there a problem?

dialogue.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
dialogue.text: No, you're travelling together.  I want to talk to you together.  Hi, how are you?  Can I take a look at your documents?  Are you related?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: We are both from Prague.

dialogue.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
dialogue.text: How long are you planning to stay?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Two weeks.

dialogue.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
dialogue.text: I'd like to speak for himself, okay?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: He doesn't speak English.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Who is he?

dialogue.speaker: VENDOR
dialogue.text: New York's finest.  This is his case.

dialogue.speaker: VENDOR
dialogue.text: This all you want?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Do you know how much killer gets for movie rights?

dialogue.speaker: VENDOR
dialogue.text: In here, says he wants a million.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Million?!  The killer gets one million dollars for a television interview?

dialogue.speaker: VENDOR
dialogue.text: Hey, tabloids paid Ted Bundy - famous serial killer - half a million for his interview.  And how much you think Monica got for writing book about the President coming on to her?  It pays to be a killer or a whore in this country. Look, you want magazine or not?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Yes.  Both.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Just do what I do.  Say the same thing I say.  Don't open your mouth.

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Don't fool around.

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Did you hear what I said?

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: I want to document my trip to America.

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: Look.  Times Square.  Just like in the movies!

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
dialogue.text: Don't speak Russian!

dialogue.speaker: OLEG
dialogue.text: Why?  Why do I always have to speak to you in Czech?

dialogue.speaker: EMIL
