dialogue.text: Jack, come on, there is an official department policy about cop killings. Cop killers represent a special priority because any man crazy enough to kill a cop is a greater threat to an unarmed civilian... In other words, we can't seen like we're in the revenge business... I know, we all know the truth's a little different.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Yeah...

dialogue.speaker: HADEN
dialogue.text: Anthing botherin' you besides losin' your gun?

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Yeah.  It bothers me when cops get hurt while I'm makin' a play. I don't like it.

dialogue.speaker: HADEN
dialogue.text: You might be more of a team player and a little less of a hot dog on this one, Jack.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Being a hot dog's worked pretty well for me so far... Besides, I got a lead...

dialogue.speaker: HADEN
dialogue.text: Okay.  You're not a team player. You gotta do things your own way. Fine.  Nail this guy and make us all look good.  But you better watch your ass.  If you screw up, I can promise you, you're goin' down.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: You really know how to send a guy out with a great attitude. He starts to go.

dialogue.speaker: HADEN
dialogue.text: Jack?

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: HADEN
dialogue.text: Try not to get your ass shot to pieces. We got enough dead cops on this one.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: I'll keep it in mind.

dialogue.speaker: HADEN
dialogue.text: What the bell happened?

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: I lost them, that's what happened.

dialogue.speaker: HADEN
dialogue.text: How did they get away?

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: They ran.  As fast as they could. Caught a train.

dialogue.speaker: HADEN
dialogue.text: Which one pulled the trigger?

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: The Indian.  I was about 30 yards away.

dialogue.speaker: HADEN
dialogue.text: You couldn't get to him?

dialogue.speaker: HADEN
dialogue.text: What a screw-up.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Right.  I screwed up.  I fucked up. I messed up.  Anybody could have done better, especially you. I bet you're real good at hitting targets through crowds.

dialogue.speaker: HADEN
dialogue.text: Don't duck the bullet Cates. Why didn't you call in for backup instead of makin' a grandstand play?

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: I didn't have the time.

dialogue.speaker: HADEN
dialogue.text: Too bad, it would've covered your ass.  Now you're in the shit and so's the department. In case you haven't noticed, this wasn't our finest hour... I told you everyone was watchin' on this one. Maybe you better start thinkin' about writin' tickets off a three wheel bike.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: He's got more brains and more guts in one corner of his asshole than any cop I've worked with.

dialogue.speaker: HADEN
dialogue.text: Just cause you say it with conviction don't mean shit to me... How you gonna take to a pink slip, huh?.

dialogue.speaker: HADEN
dialogue.text: Where the Christ do you think you're going?

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: I'm taking my prisoner back to jail.

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG COP
dialogue.text: That's what you say, Cates...

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG COP
dialogue.text: But that's what you say about all of us all the tine ... we're always the ones fucking up when you tell it...

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: The truth hurts, doesn't it, buddy?

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG COP
dialogue.text: Somebody steals your gun, you're supposed to file a report.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Are you gonna tell me about police procedure?  Do me a favor, don't give me a bunch of crap.

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG COP
dialogue.text: I guess when two cops die on account of your fuck up you want to keep it as quiet as possible...

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Is that what this guy Ganz had in the hotel?

dialogue.speaker: KEHOE
dialogue.text: Every last bit of it.  The big guy's room was empty.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: I'll help you out.

dialogue.speaker: KEHOE
dialogue.text: This guy must have had a .44 like yours, Jack. Now he's got yours.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Shit.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Billy Bear...

dialogue.speaker: KEHOE
dialogue.text: Backup man from the East Bay. Worked with Ganz a few years ago and sprung him from the road gang.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Who are all these?

dialogue.speaker: KEHOE
dialogue.text: They all pulled a bunch of jobs with Ganz about four years ago.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Wait a minute, wait a minute... who's this?

dialogue.speaker: KEHOE
dialogue.text: Uhh ... Wong, Henry Wong.  He was in on the same job.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Tell me that's not the same guy.

dialogue.speaker: KEHOE
dialogue.text: Hey ... Dick Tracy.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: I think I wanna have a discussion about it with any of the ones still walking.  Can we find them?

dialogue.speaker: KEHOE
dialogue.text: Here's the file. Cates checks the file.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: One of  em's in the slam.

dialogue.speaker: KEHOE
dialogue.text: You look awful.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: So do you...been a long day.

dialogue.speaker: KEHOE
dialogue.text: Long night, too, from what I heard ... Word's going around that in addition to losing Ganz for the second time, and in addition to Haden busting you back to Patrolman, some jig beat the crap out of you.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Aw, bullshit, you heard wrong.

dialogue.speaker: KEHOE
dialogue.text: Doesn't look like it.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Nothing came in for me yet?  No calls?

dialogue.speaker: KEHOE
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Bullshit red tape.

dialogue.speaker: KEHOE
dialogue.text: I'm heading out. How about you?

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: I got to wait for a call.

dialogue.speaker: KEHOE
dialogue.text: Okay.  See you in the morning... you know, you ought to get some rest...

dialogue.speaker: KEHOE
dialogue.text: I almost forgot.  That pal of yours from the Vice Squad wants you to call him.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Jesus Christ.  Why the hell didn't you tell me before?

dialogue.speaker: KEHOE
dialogue.text: I'm not paid to take your personal calls.  He was in some bar. .. off duty.

dialogue.speaker: LUTHER
dialogue.text: A cop...

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: I sure ain't his fairy godmother... now I'm looking for Ganz...where is he?

dialogue.speaker: LUTHER
dialogue.text: Haven't seen him for years. That's the truth.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: You just took a shot at me, asshole. I think you do know where he is.

dialogue.speaker: LUTHER
dialogue.text: Who gives a fuck what you think?

dialogue.speaker: LUTHER
dialogue.text: Ganz and Billy got my girl, Rosalie.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: I think I met her.  Now tell us something we don't know, like where they stashed her.

dialogue.speaker: LUTHER
dialogue.text: I don't know.

dialogue.speaker: LUTHER
dialogue.text: He ... he wants me to help him skip town.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: When? How?

dialogue.speaker: LUTHER
dialogue.text: I dunno ... he's gonna call me...

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: What am I wanted for?

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: I don't answer questions, I ask 'em...

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: I don't think your gun's loaded...

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: This is a .44 Magnum, the most powerful handgun in the world. You gotta ask yourself just one question. Are you feelin' lucky?

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: I still don't think it's loaded.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Hey, you're right.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: You're hopeless.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: That's the way I see it, too.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: I'm all wet.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: What's wrong with that?

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: A guy in the bar called me a dumb bitch today.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: What'd you do?

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Irrigated his face with the shot of J and B I'd just poured him. Then I tried to deck the sucker.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: I guess he got the message...

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Then I sit back and I think, I mean, who's to say I'm not a dumb bitch.  I work in a bar, right? I can't read a list of my academic credentials to every booze-hound that comes in the place... You are what you do...

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Positive self-image problem all over again ... You are who you decide you are unless you're the type that lets assholes decide for you.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Aren't you the one that thinks all psychotherapy is bullshit?

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: I do think all psychotherapy is bullshit. But just because I think it's bullshit doesn't mean I don't know something about it.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: If this is your idea of sympathetic interest in my problems, I'll take brutal indifference.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Hey, you know what I really think?

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Tell me--I'm dyin' to hear it.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: I think you're ashamed to tend bar which is sad because you look great in that outfit they make you wear... You pull down four bills a week which is damn good, and you mix the best Pina Coladas I've ever had... I think that if you need bigger and better things ... then go for em.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: You know, if you let me come over to your place once in a while, you could put on a clean shirt in the morning.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: What makes you think I have any clean shirts at my place?

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Maybe you ought to buy me one.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Maybe I would if I knew when you were coming back.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: That's a fairly crummy way to start a morning.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Maybe I got a fairly crummy day ahead.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Maybe that makes a nice excuse.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Maybe you don't know what the hell you're talking about.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: When you start with that attitude... it's like I don't know who you are.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: What do you want to know?  What difference does it make?  I'm the guy in your bed the last three months.  I make you feel good. You make me feel good.  What the hell else do you want from a guy?

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: I wish you'd stop trying to make me mad so I won't care for you... I wish you'd give me a little more of a chance.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: You know something, Jack, you really are hopeless.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: That's the way I see it, too.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Call me later.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: You sure you want me to?

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Yeah, for some reason, I'm sure...

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Thanks for the coffee.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: I think you forgot this. Hands him his wallet and badge...

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Guess people ought to know who I am...

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Great place for lunch.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Yeah, one of my favorites.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: You made the front page.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Yeah, Guess it must have been a slow news day...

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Jack, are you okay?

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Sure, okay, fine, no problem... See, there's this kid in jail ... First thing I got to do is go up and see what he knows ...

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Look, spare me the macho bullshit about your gun...

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Bullshit?  I'll tell you about bullshit.  My gun's a real weapon in the hands of a real maniac who knows how to use it.  It isn't my macho bullshit that's killing people, my gun is ...

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Look, Jack, if you make everything your personal responsibility, you'll turn into a bad cop.  It's not a practical way to function...

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: I didn't get burned, two cops did. Listen, I'll tell you about personnel responsibility.  I like to get the job done right.  And if I don't get my job done right... I'm for shit.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Here it comes again ... the sacred job...

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: That's right.  I'm not like you. I'm not gonna sit on my ass wondering what's right and what's wrong... There's a psycho out there killing people with my gun and I'm gonna get him.  Because it's my job. And if you don't get that...

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: I get that. The job first. Everything else, especially me, second. I get it. I don't like it.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Just one.  Some lady called.  Said she's a little hot-headed sometimes... But she still wants her occasional roommate. She'd like to talk it over after she gets off work tonight... if it's humanly possible....

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Elaine, look, I'm in the middle of sone stuff right now... I'm not gonna have time to come by. I don't know when I can get there.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Listen, Goddamn it if you think I'm happy about it, you're nuts. I just gotta take care of a few things, okay?

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: This is not the way people who care for each other are supposed to behave.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: I'm at work, asshole.  Where else?

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Elaine! I... I'm sorry... I was expecting somebody else... police business.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: No wonder you're so popular.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: No, it's I'm just surprised you called.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: So am I.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: The number ... what's the Goddamn number?

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Jack?  What was that?

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Elaine, I gotta put you on hold...

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Jack, wait...

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Just a second, that's all!

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Hello.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Hi, it's me...

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Fuck you.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Hey, I don't believe it.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Hiya, kid.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: I ought to have you and your friend thrown out...

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Don't.  We've had a hard night.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: I can see that.  Pardon me for saying so, but you look like shit.  What happened?

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: We and my pal here have been taking it on the chin for the last few hours...

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: You real down?

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: I've been better...Dead end.  No Ganz, no Indian.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Nothing.  No sign of Ganz.  No sign of the Indian.  Airport's clean.  Train station. Bus station.  Docks... Shit...

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Ganz is going to be hard to track. Just a pure schizo ... wires all crossed... totally without any pattern... kill anybody... The Indian... himself... anybody...

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: How do you know?

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Jack, it's all over the papers. He's an obvious type.  But this Indian...

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: What makes you think they were lesbians, or as you so quaintly put it, dykes?

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Come on, they were a little old for a slumber party.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: It might pay to reexamine a few of your more primitive notions.  I was in bed with a girlfriend watching TV last week, Jack, and one thing we know about me is I happen not to be a lesbian ... Now, if this Indian's girlfriend got upset when you came looking for him, it could just be she's still vulnerable to him.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: So what?

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: When a guy hurts you, then comes back bleeding on his hands and knees, who knows, he might just be irrestible.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Hey, Come on, shrink time's over. They wouldn't go see some old girlfriend.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah, well look where you came when you were down and out.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Whaddya think?

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: What do I know?  I'm just a bartender.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Let's go, Reggie.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: How'd they take it back at headquarters?

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Usual bullshit.  You make one smart move and everybody wants to be your friend... You know somethin', shootin' guys sucks. Especially compared to this.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: I've been waiting a long time to hear you say that.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Yeah, bein' a hard-ass all the time is a real drag, but it works.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Three more hours...

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Where is he?

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: Promised I'd turn my back while he... ah, never mind...

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Tell me.

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: He's takin' care of the same business I'll be takin' care of - soon as I dry off.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: You're impossible...

dialogue.speaker: CATES
dialogue.text: That's what I always say.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Who the hell are you?

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: Name's Hammond, Reggie Hammond. I heard a lot about you. And any friend of Jack's is a friend of mine.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: I'm not so sure I can say the same thing...You don't look like a cop.

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: Well, I been workin' the other side of the street for the last few years.  And you don't exactly look like a shrink, wearin' that dress...

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: Shrink major, not a shrink.

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: Hard man to live with.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: How would you know?

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: Hey, two days with him is enough.

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: That's no bull.

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: He was the only one of my bunch that was my friend... He was loyal, went all the way for you...

dialogue.speaker: ELAINE
dialogue.text: In all due respect, he sounds kind of pathetic to me.  The kind of guy that runs home to his momma or some girlfriend.  Have you two ace detectives checked that out?

dialogue.speaker: LISA
dialogue.text: Hey...

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: Shut up.

dialogue.speaker: LISA
dialogue.text: What the hell's wrong?  I didn't do anything.

dialogue.speaker: LISA
dialogue.text: What do you want?  What's goin' on?

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: Shut up.

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: Stall.

dialogue.speaker: LISA
dialogue.text: What do you want?

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: Keep stallin'.

dialogue.speaker: LISA
dialogue.text: Alright, I'm coming...hold on.

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: How hot are they?

dialogue.speaker: HENRY
dialogue.text: Hot?  Hey, they're not even room temperature.

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: How ya doin'?

dialogue.speaker: HENRY
dialogue.text: Can't complain.

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: We got a lot to talk about.

dialogue.speaker: HENRY
dialogue.text: Yeah, old times.

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: We'll follow you.  Take it slow,okay?

dialogue.speaker: HENRY
dialogue.text: Sure, right.

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: Surprise, Luther.

dialogue.speaker: LUTHER
dialogue.text: Whaddya want?  I thought you were locked up-

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: I want the money, asshole, what do you think?  The money that Reggie hid...

dialogue.speaker: LUTHER
dialogue.text: I don't know what you're talkin' about.

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: You want that Indian to snap her neck?

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: Instead of worryin' about Reggie, you better worry about me...

dialogue.speaker: LUTHER
dialogue.text: Don't give me this, we were partners.

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: Billy, go ahead, break it...

dialogue.speaker: LUTHER
dialogue.text: No! Don't kill her.  I can get you the money.

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: When?

dialogue.speaker: LUTHER
dialogue.text: I can't get it until Monday. Honest.

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: You chickenshit punk...

dialogue.speaker: LUTHER
dialogue.text: Honest. The place we stashed it opens Monday morning. I can't get it till then. Monday morning, that's when it opens. After that, I'll get the money to you right away...

dialogue.speaker: LUTHER
dialogue.text: Come on, you can trust me. Please.

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: You try to mess with us or go to the cops, I promise you, I'll put holes in her you wouldn't believe.

dialogue.speaker: LUTHER
dialogue.text: Let her go.

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: First, the money.

dialogue.speaker: LUTHER
dialogue.text: Rosalie, you okay?

dialogue.speaker: GANZ
dialogue.text: What are you talkin' about? I said I wouldn't hurt her.

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: How you doing, man?

dialogue.speaker: SOSNA
dialogue.text: Not bad, not bad.

dialogue.speaker: SOSNA
dialogue.text: You want to go outside?

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: Naw, right here's okay.

dialogue.speaker: SOSNA
dialogue.text: You sure?

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: I'm sure.  Everybody here's looking at everybody else's ass.

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: How about some ammo?

dialogue.speaker: SOSNA
dialogue.text: It's loaded... I got some shells in here.

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: How much?

dialogue.speaker: SOSNA
dialogue.text: This is clean shit.  No serial numbers and never been used...

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: Don't mess with me. How much?

dialogue.speaker: SOSNA
dialogue.text: Five bills.

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: Five.  On credit.

dialogue.speaker: SOSNA
dialogue.text: This ain't a credit business.

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: Yeah, I know that, but this is me and we're old friends. I haven't got the money so what are you gonna do about it?

dialogue.speaker: SOSNA
dialogue.text: Give it back.

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: Try and take it.

dialogue.speaker: SOSNA
dialogue.text: Fuck you.  You got no right for this kind of play.

dialogue.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogue.text: I'll got your money to you. No sweat.

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: Appipulai Leeloo Minai..

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: Corn-i-Lius?

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: At your service.

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: What're you laughing about?

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: Napoleon... small.

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: The case..with the stones... Where is it?

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: San Agamat chay bet... envolet!

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: The case was stolen?

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: Ikset-kiba.  Me imanetaba oum dalat!

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: You know exactly where they are!

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: Vano da, mechteba?! Soun domo kala chon hammas!

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: No, I'm not proud of myself... But we don't have the luxury of choice.

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: Akta dedero ansila do mektet.

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: I can't pretend to be your husband... David's in great shape.

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: ...We're saved!

dialogue.speaker: ZORG
dialogue.text: I'm fucked!

dialogue.speaker: ZORG
dialogue.text: Zorg. Jean-Baptiste Emmanuel Zorg... nice to see you again

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: I remember you now..the so called art dealer.

dialogue.speaker: ZORG
dialogue.text: I'm glad you got your memory back, Father... Because you're going to need it... Where are the stones?

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: ...Why on earth do the stones interest you?

dialogue.speaker: ZORG
dialogue.text: Personally, they are of no interest to me, I'd rather sell weapons..but I have a customer... so tell me...

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: Even it I did know where the stones were I would never tell somebody like you.

dialogue.speaker: ZORG
dialogue.text: Why?  What's wrong with me?

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: ...I'm a priest! I'm here to serve life, All you want to do is destroy it.

dialogue.speaker: ZORG
dialogue.text: Ah, Father... You are so wrong. Let me explain...

dialogue.speaker: ZORG
dialogue.text: ...would you like a drink?

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: No thank you.

dialogue.speaker: ZORG
dialogue.text: Follow me.. Life, which you so nobly serve, comes from destruction. Look at this empty glass.

dialogue.speaker: ZORG
dialogue.text: ...Look at all these little things... so busy all of a sudden. Notice how each one is useful. What a lovely ballet, so full of form and color.  So full of..life!

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: They are robots!

dialogue.speaker: ZORG
dialogue.text: Father, by creating a little destruction, I am, in fact, encouraging life!  So, in reality, you and I are in the same business!

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: Destroying a glass is one thing..killing people with the weapons you produce is quite another.

dialogue.speaker: ZORG
dialogue.text: Let me reassure you Father..I will never kill more people in my entire life than religion has killed in the last 2000 years.

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: You are a monster, Zorg!

dialogue.speaker: ZORG
dialogue.text: I know...

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Excuse me, I'm looking for a priest.

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: Weddings are one floor down. Congratulations.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: She's not my bride, she's my fare. She's looking for this Vito Cornelius. According to the phone guide he lives here.

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: That's me.  But I don't know who she is... where did you find her?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: She dropped in on me... holding this.

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: Who are you?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I brought the girl remember?

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: The girl?

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: He's a she!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: You noticed...

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: There's not a moment to lose! Wake her up, but be gentle about it!  This woman is mankind's most precious possession! She is... perfect!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: So you do know her.

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: Uh yes, we're cousins..distant cousins..

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: They all like this in your family, father?

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: She's an exception..

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: Thank you so much for your help Mr...?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Dallas. Korben Dallas.

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: Yes. That's fine! Thank you very much. A thousand times over!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I might call to check up on her, you know... to see if she's better?

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: She's fine, really..don't you worry.. just needs some rest..she's had a very long trip.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I know. I was there when she arrived.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Excuse me! Just one thing!  She said something to me a while ago and... I don't really get it... Akta Gamat?

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: It means, "Never without my permission".

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: That's what I thought.

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: I'm sorry to have to resort to such methods, but we heard about your good luck on he radio and we need the tickets to Fhloston.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Is that the usual way priests go on vacation?

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: We're not going on vacation..we're on a mission..

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: What kind of mission?

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: We have to save the world.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Good luck..

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: Of course.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Father, I was in the Army for awhile and every time they told us we were on a mission to save the world the only thing that changed was I lost a lot of friends. So thanks for the offer.. but no thanks.

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: What are you doing?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Trying to save your ass so you can save the world.

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: You're probably very angry with me and I quite understand. But I want you to know I'm fighting for a noble cause.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Yeah, I know... to save the world... but right now all I want to do is save Leeloo.

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: Leeloo's in trouble?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: When is she not in trouble?

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: Uh.. Have you tried the Diva's suite?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Don't tell me you don't know how all this works?

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: Theoretically, yes! The four Stones form the beam and the Fifth Element is supposed to stand in the middle there, but... I don't have the reference book. I've never seen the Stones work!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: There's no light! You told me there were supposed to be four beams of light.

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: Yes, of course, but... The Stones are shut! They have to be open for it to work.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: And you don't know how they open, is that what you are saying?

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: That's what I'm saying.

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: Imagine for a moment that this. thing is not anything that can be identified because it prefers not to be, because it is the antithesis of all we are. Because it is evil.. TOTAL EVIL.

dialogue.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogue.text: One more reason to shoot first eh?

dialogue.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogue.text: Your theory is interesting Father but I don't think we have time to go into it right now!

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: Time is of no importance, Mr. President. Only life is important.

dialogue.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogue.text: That's exactly what we are going to try and do: Protect the lives of some 200 billion of our fellow citizens! General? You may fire when ready.

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: We have forty-eight hours, the time it needs to adapt itself to our living conditions.

dialogue.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogue.text: And then?

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: And then it will be too late. The goal of evil is to wipe out life! All forms of life. For all eternity...Life upsets it.

dialogue.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogue.text: Is there anything that can stop it?

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: Yes..thank God..

dialogue.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogue.text: But what happens if instead of this... Ultimate Warrior... it is EVIL who stands here?

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: White turns to black.  Light to Dark. Life to Death.  For all eternity.

dialogue.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogue.text: Did you see that..thing..swallow our battleship like a gum drop?  You can't even tell me what it is! I ask you for options you give me bullshit. Give them permission to enter our territories with my warmest regards.

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: Thank you, Mr. President.

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: What are we going to do?

dialogue.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogue.text: This is government business now. You ought to go home and get some rest, Father.

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: It's a miracle!!!

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: What is?

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: I can't wear these clothes! This calls for dignity! I have to dress the part!

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: Father, will you please explain what's going on?

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: The Supreme Being, the fifth element is here, in our parish!!! It's a miracle!!!

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: Father.  You sure she's the Supreme Being?

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: Absolutely sure There's the triple suns on her gloves!

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: What's she doing?

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: Learning our history! The last 5000 years that she missed! She's been out of circulation a while, you know.

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: Uh father, I know she's been through a lot... but the sacred stones..we don't have much time..

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: Yes. Of course..

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: There was this guy with a limp who came a month ago..said he was an art dealer ... Asking all these questions about the Sacred Stones..at the time I didn't think anything of it.. What was his name? I'm so bad with names...

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: I didn't know your size.

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: They really made her...

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: Perfect.

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: I got it!  Everything  here we need to know about Fhloston Paradise Hotel... and a detailed blueprint of the entire hotel!

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: Good work, my son.  Now all we need is a way to get there.

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: Where's Leeloo?

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: On the plane... with Mr. Dallas... the real one.

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: It's all my fault.  I'm the servant... It's my mission! Here!

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: You're all safe. Thanks be to God!

dialogue.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogue.text: Later, David! Later! There's not a minute to lose!

dialogue.speaker: DIVA
dialogue.text: You're a good man... She was right to have chosen you...

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Who?

dialogue.speaker: DIVA
dialogue.text: The Fifth Element... The Supreme Being... Your wife...

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Leeloo... is... she's...

dialogue.speaker: DIVA
dialogue.text: Yes, and more than that... You must give her the Stones, she's the only one who knows how to use them.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: ...So Cornelius was telling the truth!

dialogue.speaker: DIVA
dialogue.text: She was taught to love the life of others... but not her own. You have to teach her to love if you want her to truly live!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I'll help her, I promise, but I think you should tell me where the Stones are!

dialogue.speaker: DIVA
dialogue.text: Do you love her?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I... I don't know! We hardly know each other... it takes time!

dialogue.speaker: DIVA
dialogue.text: I don't have time... I need to know.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Listen, the last time I admitted to a woman I loved her ... I never saw her again.

dialogue.speaker: DIVA
dialogue.text: I would like to have died in peace...

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, but... the Stones...

dialogue.speaker: DIVA
dialogue.text: They are... with me...

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: FINGER
dialogue.text: Hey bud! Finger here.

dialogue.speaker: FINGER
dialogue.text: I love you too Major, but you haven't called me that since basic training.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I was talking to the cat.

dialogue.speaker: FINGER
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah, I forgot.You still prefer your cat to the real thing.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: At least, the cat comes back.

dialogue.speaker: FINGER
dialogue.text: You still pining for that two timing bitch. Forget her. There are a million women out there.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I don't want a million - I just want one.  A perfect one.

dialogue.speaker: FINGER
dialogue.text: Don't exist bud.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I just found a picture of you.

dialogue.speaker: FINGER
dialogue.text: How do I look?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Like shit.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I don't need one.

dialogue.speaker: FINGER
dialogue.text: You forgetting who sat next to you for a thousand missions. I know how you drive.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Finger!  I'm driving a cab now, not a space fighter!!

dialogue.speaker: FINGER
dialogue.text: How many points you got left on your license?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Uh... at least fifty.

dialogue.speaker: FINGER
dialogue.text: In your dreams! See you tonight!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Hello?

dialogue.speaker: FINGER
dialogue.text: Hey bud...I'm waiting all day here.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Finger..man..I'm sorry..listen..I was on the way over but I had a fare fall into my lap.. y'know one of those big fares you just can't resist..

dialogue.speaker: FINGER
dialogue.text: So, just how big was this fare?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: 5'7", green eyes... long legs... great skin... perfect..

dialogue.speaker: FINGER
dialogue.text: Uh huh..and I don't suppose you got the name of this..perfect fare..

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Leeloo..

dialogue.speaker: GIRL
dialogue.text: Akina delutan, nou-shan.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: ...'Scuse me?

dialogue.speaker: GIRL
dialogue.text: Daya deo dono Dato.  Dalutan!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: It there's one thing I don't need advice on, it's how to drive.

dialogue.speaker: GIRL
dialogue.text: ...Priest...

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: You're not that bad... Come on we'll get you to a doctor.

dialogue.speaker: GIRL
dialogue.text: Vito... Cor... Ni-lious... Priest...

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Vito Cornelius?

dialogue.speaker: GIRL
dialogue.text: Eto Akta Gamat!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, it's just that... I was told to wake you up gently, so I figured...

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: ...What's your name?

dialogue.speaker: GIRL
dialogue.text: Leeloo Minai Lekarariba-Laminai-Tchai Ekbat De Sebat.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Hey,  that's... cute... Do you have a nickname, something a little... shorter?

dialogue.speaker: GIRL
dialogue.text: ...Leeloo.

dialogue.speaker: PRIEST
dialogue.text: The Fifth Element...

dialogue.speaker: KOMMANDER
dialogue.text: Take them and put them in a safe place.

dialogue.speaker: PRIEST
dialogue.text: Will the elements be gone now forever from this place?

dialogue.speaker: KOMMANDER
dialogue.text: When mankind comes to its senses. We will return.

dialogue.speaker: PRIEST
dialogue.text: Knowing mankind as I do, that could take centuries!

dialogue.speaker: KOMMANDER
dialogue.text: Time is of no importance, only life is important.

dialogue.speaker: KOMMANDER
dialogue.text: When EVIL returns so shall we.

dialogue.speaker: PRIEST
dialogue.text: We will be ready, Lord.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: ...Hello?

dialogue.speaker: MOTHER
dialogue.text: You're the nastiest dirtbag I know in this stinking City!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Hi Ma...

dialogue.speaker: MOTHER
dialogue.text: I've been playing twice a week for 20 years, 20 years I've been eating those shitty croquettes.

dialogue.speaker: MOTHER
dialogue.text: Are you listening to me, you ingrate!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Yes ma..

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Other than that... You all right?

dialogue.speaker: MOTHER
dialogue.text: ...And now you're making fun of me? I'm warning you! If you don't take me after all these years of sacrifice, I'll never forgive you!!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I'm coming!. Ma, what're you talking about?

dialogue.speaker: MOTHER
dialogue.text: I get it! You want to make me beg, is that it?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: All I want is an explanation! I just got in, I lost my job. I smashed my cab. I got mugged, but other than that everything's peachy, Ma, thanks for asking!! Now settle down and explain to me calmly..

dialogue.speaker: MOTHER
dialogue.text: You just won a trip, you dolt! Ten days in Fhloston Paradise for two!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Ma. If I'd won, I'd know about it. Someone would have notified me.

dialogue.speaker: MOTHER
dialogue.text: They've been blaring out your name on the radio for the last hour, blockhead!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: MOTHER
dialogue.text: Have you pulled yourself together?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: ...Not yet.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Hello?

dialogue.speaker: MOTHER
dialogue.text: You little sleaze bag!

dialogue.speaker: MOTHER
dialogue.text: Don't you ever ask me for another thing in my life again, you've killed your poor mother with your own hands!

dialogue.speaker: VOICE
dialogue.text: Welcome on board Mr. Dallas..

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: How you doing this morning?  Sleep OK? I didn't.

dialogue.speaker: VOICE
dialogue.text: Fuel level 6.03..Propulsion 2x4...

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I had the worst goddamn nightmare.

dialogue.speaker: VOICE
dialogue.text: You have nine points left on your license..

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Thanks for reminding me..

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I'm sorry..

dialogue.speaker: VOICE
dialogue.text: This is a police control action..

dialogue.speaker: VOICE
dialogue.text: 30 seconds...

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Anyone know how to release the lines on this crate?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Found it?

dialogue.speaker: LOC RHOD
dialogue.text: Does it get any better or what!

dialogue.speaker: LOC RHOD
dialogue.text: ...Quiver ladies, he's gonna set the world on fire right here from 5 to 7! You'll know everything there is to know about the D-man. His dreams, his desires, his most intimate of intimates.  And from what I'm looking at intimate is the stud muffin's middle name. So tell me my main man... you nervous in the service?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Uh... not really.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I didn't come here to play Dumbo on the radio. So tomorrow between 5 and 7 give yourself a hand, that clear pal?

dialogue.speaker: LOC RHOD
dialogue.text: Crystal.

dialogue.speaker: LOC RHOD
dialogue.text: My main man! Please don't leave me here alone. My head's killing me and my adoring fans are gonna tear me apart! Get me outta here!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I'll take you to the bar, after that, you're on your own.

dialogue.speaker: LOC RHOD
dialogue.text: Oh, yes! Do that! You treat me right, man. Tell me all about yourself, your roots, your personal life, your childhood dreams...

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I don't think this is a good time...

dialogue.speaker: LOC RHOD
dialogue.text: ...You got brothers and sisters? What about your dad? Tell me about your dad! What was he like? Physically? Big, I suppose?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Yeah, very big, a giant.

dialogue.speaker: LOC RHOD
dialogue.text: I didn't have a dad... never saw him... never even heard him. 50 billion people listen to me every day... and he doesn't hear me...

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: You don't do what I say... I'll waste you myself. Got it?

dialogue.speaker: LOC RHOD
dialogue.text: Got it...

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Six to the left. One to the right.

dialogue.speaker: LOC RHOD
dialogue.text: He's on vacation.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: We got to find the leader. Mangalores don't fight without a leader.

dialogue.speaker: LOC RHOD
dialogue.text: Maybe we oughta be going, what do you think?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Not without Leeloo.

dialogue.speaker: LOC RHOD
dialogue.text: Like Korben, can I have 30 seconds of your time here?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I'll be right back.

dialogue.speaker: LOC RHOD
dialogue.text: You know how to fly this thing?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: It's like a cab isn't it?

dialogue.speaker: LOC RHOD
dialogue.text: I don't even know what I'm looking for!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Fuck it! Hold tight!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Solid little jobs, aren't they?

dialogue.speaker: LOC RHOD
dialogue.text: Dear listeners, your favorite DJ is alive and kicking. It's seven o'clock and time for the news. Tune in tomorrow for another adventure.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: What did you say? What did you do?

dialogue.speaker: LOC RHOD
dialogue.text: Nothing! Swear to God, I didn't do nothing!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Look, you did something that set it off. Try to remember. Concentrate. Tell me exactly what you did!!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Is that all?

dialogue.speaker: LOC RHOD
dialogue.text: Yeah... then I sighed... like this.

dialogue.speaker: MUNRO
dialogue.text: Major Dallas, if our calculations are correct you still have 57 hours owed to the Federal Army on your enlistment which is more than you will need for a mission of the utmost importance.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: What mission?

dialogue.speaker: MUNRO
dialogue.text: To save the world.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Where have I heard this song before?

dialogue.speaker: MUNRO
dialogue.text: You're to leave immediately for Fhloston Paradise. Retrieve four Stones from the Diva Plavalaguna. And bring them back with the utmost discretion as possible. Any questions'?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Just one... why me?

dialogue.speaker: MUNRO
dialogue.text: Three reasons... One: As part of The Elite Special Forces Unit of the Federated Army you are an expert in the use of all weapons and spacecraft needed for this mission.

dialogue.speaker: MUNRO
dialogue.text: Two: Of all the members of your unit you were the most highly decorated.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: And the third one?

dialogue.speaker: MUNRO
dialogue.text: You're the only one left alive...

dialogue.speaker: MUNRO
dialogue.text: Don't you open your messages?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I've had enough good news for today

dialogue.speaker: MUNRO
dialogue.text: You have won the annual Gemini contest and a trip to Fhloston Paradise. For two. Congratulations. Here are your tickets.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: You couldn't come up with something a little more discreet?

dialogue.speaker: MUNRO
dialogue.text: Old tricks are the best tricks eh?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I'm not going.

dialogue.speaker: MUNRO
dialogue.text: Why not?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: One reason... I want to stay the only one left alive.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: ...Shit!

dialogue.speaker: MUNRO
dialogue.text: What is it?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: It's my wife.

dialogue.speaker: MUNRO
dialogue.text: I thought you were divorced.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I mean my future.. my ex.. My future ex.. if she sees you here I'm finished.  She hates you guys. It's what killed us in the first place. Please...

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: ...Sorry, General, but we've got no choice! It'll only take a minute! Let me set up another meeting and I'll be back.

dialogue.speaker: MUNRO
dialogue.text: Three of us will never fit in there!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Oh, yes you will...

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: Apipoulai!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I suppose that means "Hi" ?

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: Valo massa... Chacha hamas.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Uh..you're welcome.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: You hear that?

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: Cornelius..

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Oh god!

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: Dinoine chagantakat!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Took the words right out of my mouth. Go on... I'll be right with you.  It's our honeymoon. We're going to use the trip to get to know each other better.

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: Apipoulai!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Not hard to find you...just follow the Chaos...

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: Love...

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Yes! But "love" isn't the operative word here, PEACE is!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Sometimes you can't learn everything from a screen..sometimes it's better to ask someone who has experience..

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: What is... Make Love?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Finished what?

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: Learning language.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Which one?

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: All 900.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: You learned 900 languages in five minutes?!

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: Yes! Now it's your turn! I learned your language, you have to learn mine!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I know how to say "Hello". Teach me how to say "Good-bye", that's all I need.

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: Apipoussan!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Apipoussan?

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: Good! Do you know how we say "make love"?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Uh...

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: ...Hoppi-hoppa.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Here we go again...

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: You know women normally change five times more than men.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: You get that off the screen?

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: Yes... you know there's a lot of differences between men women.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: You noticed..

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: OK, you can turn around!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Where you going?

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: I'm going to see the Diva sing. What's the matter?... Do I look bad?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: No, not at all!  I mean, just the opposite, you're... you're beautiful!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I told you I need to work in peace. Remember? I need to concentrate.

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: And you can't concentrate with me around?.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: It's difficult.

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: You're nothing but a... a...

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: The words you're looking for weren't in the dictionary you studied. I won't be long.

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: I'm so very sad.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Why? We did pretty well, wouldn't you say?

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: Five hundred wars... Arms... Drugs... Money... Everything you create is used to destroy...

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I told you not to read all that crap!

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: Protect life... Until death.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Leeloo? The Stones! We have to open them! How does it work?

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: The wind blows... the fire burns...

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I know all that, Leeloo! I'm talking about the Stones.

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: ...The rain falls...

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: It's up to you now, Angel!

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: I'm so tired...

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: You can sleep tomorrow... come on...

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: I want to sleep... forever...

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Leeloo! Listen to me! I'll take you on a vacation afterwards! A real vacation, this time, for as long as you want. Come on! You can do it!

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: What's the use of saving lives... when you see what you do with them!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: You're right but there are lots of good things... beautiful things...

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: ...Like love...

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Exactly.

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: But I don't know love... I'm like a machine programmed to save other people's lives but never to have one of my own.

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: I have thousands of memories but none of them are mine... There is no need for me other than this. I'm immortal but I have no life.

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Yes, you do! I need you. More than you can imagine! Stand up straight!

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: Why?... Why would you need me?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Because...

dialogue.speaker: LEELOO
dialogue.text: Tell me...

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I love you...

dialogue.speaker: THAI
dialogue.text: Not going to open?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: I've never gotten a message that wasn't bad news.

dialogue.speaker: THAI
dialogue.text: How someone strong like you scared from a message? Is good news I sure!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: The last two messages I got?  The first one was from my wife telling me she was leaving! And the second was from my lawyer telling me he was leaving too... with my wife.

dialogue.speaker: THAI
dialogue.text: You right that is bad.. but mathematically luck must change! Grandfather say: "It never rain every day." This is good news guarantee.. I bet you lunch!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: At least I won lunch.

dialogue.speaker: THAI
dialogue.text: Good philosophy..see good in bad.. I like..I prepare number one dessert.. special for you and pussy..

dialogue.speaker: MUGGER
dialogue.text: The cash man!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Been here long?

dialogue.speaker: MUGGER
dialogue.text: Don't fuck with me man or I'll blow you into tomorrow!

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: Isn't that a Z140? Alleviated titanium. Neuro charged assault model?

dialogue.speaker: MUGGER
dialogue.text: Uh..

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: You know you could hurt someone with this puppy..good thing it's not loaded..

dialogue.speaker: MUGGER
dialogue.text: It's not?

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: You gotta push the little yellow button...

dialogue.speaker: MUGGER
dialogue.text: Thanks..

dialogue.speaker: KORBEN
dialogue.text: You're welcome..

dialogue.speaker: MUNRO
dialogue.text: This is all that survived?

dialogue.speaker: MACTILBURGH
dialogue.text: Actually only one cell survived..

dialogue.speaker: MUNRO
dialogue.text: Have you identified it?

dialogue.speaker: MACTILBURGH
dialogue.text: It's not that easy..we've never encountered anything like it before..you see normal human beings have 40 DNA memo groums..which is more than enough for any species to perpetuate itself..This one has 200,000.

dialogue.speaker: MUNRO
dialogue.text: Talk English Doc.

dialogue.speaker: MACTILBURGH
dialogue.text: This cell is like a huge library. It has infinite genetic knowledge stored inside. Almost like it was...engineered.

dialogue.text: Sounds like a freak of nature to me.

dialogue.text: Yes... I can't wait to meet him.

dialogue.speaker: MACTILBURGH
dialogue.text: The compositional elements of his DNA chain are the same as ours, there are simply more of them tightly packed. His knowledge is probably limitless..

dialogue.speaker: MUNRO
dialogue.text: Is there any danger? Some kind of virus?

dialogue.speaker: MACTILBURGH
dialogue.text: We put it through the cellular hygiene detector. The cell is for lack of a better word... perfect.

dialogue.speaker: MACTILBURGH
dialogue.text: ...This is the crucial phase, The reconstruction of pigment. Cells are bombarded with slightly greasy solar atoms which forces the body cells to react, to protect themselves. That means growing skin. Clever, eh?

dialogue.speaker: MUNRO
dialogue.text: Wonderful!

dialogue.speaker: MUNRO
dialogue.text: This thing solid?

dialogue.speaker: MACTILBURGH
dialogue.text: An elephant couldn't crack it.

dialogue.speaker: MACTILBURGH
dialogue.text: It's an honor to receive you. Mr. President.

dialogue.text: I managed to contact the Mondoshawan. They deplore the incident, but accept our apologies.

dialogue.text: The-Stones weren't aboard the ship.

dialogue.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogue.text: ...What do you mean?

dialogue.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogue.text: I want your best man on this!

dialogue.speaker: MUNRO
dialogue.text: Don't worry, Sir. I have the perfect one.

dialogue.speaker: MUNRO
dialogue.text: They just landed in the desert.

dialogue.text: How much time is left?

dialogue.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogue.text: Staedert, do you read me?

dialogue.speaker: STAEDERT
dialogue.text: I can hear you, Mr. President, but I can't see you .

dialogue.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogue.text: Is that better?

dialogue.speaker: STAEDERT
dialogue.text: Perfect, Mr. President.

dialogue.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogue.text: I have to address the Supreme Council in 10 minutes. Just the facts, General.

dialogue.speaker: STAEDERT
dialogue.text: There are no results from the chemical and molecular analysis as of yet, all the calibers are overshot..we're hoping a thermo nucleatic imaging..

dialogue.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogue.text: What you are saying is you don't know what this..thing..is.

dialogue.speaker: STAEDERT
dialogue.text: Not yet Sir..The only thing we know is it just keeps getting bigger!

dialogue.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogue.text: Options.

dialogue.speaker: STAEDERT
dialogue.text: Wait or act.

dialogue.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogue.text: Recommendations.

dialogue.speaker: STAEDERT
dialogue.text: My philosophy Mr. President is shoot first ask questions later. I don't like uninvited guests.

dialogue.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogue.text: Gentlemen?

dialogue.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogue.text: Staedert?  What's going on?  Did you destroy it?

dialogue.speaker: STAEDERT
dialogue.text: I'm about to, Mr. President.

dialogue.speaker: PROFESSOR
dialogue.text: "..in which all the history of the Universe resides ..all the strength..all the hope..Protect us from Evil.."

dialogue.speaker: PRIEST
dialogue.text: Amen..

dialogue.speaker: PROFESSOR
dialogue.text: Father.. it in the most extraordinary thing.. the greatest find in history..can you imagine the implications.

dialogue.speaker: PRIEST
dialogue.text: Only too well... here you must be parched..

dialogue.text: A weapon against evil.  Amazing!  I am going to be famous.

dialogue.speaker: PRIEST
dialogue.text: Drink!

dialogue.speaker: PROFESSOR
dialogue.text: To fame.. salud..

dialogue.text: How's that? Can you hear me better now?

dialogue.text: Yes, Mr. Zorg, I hear you perfectly! So, how was the concert?

dialogue.text: Who gives a shit! I didn't come here to listen to music! Listen up instead of running off at the mouth! The batteries on my phone are almost gone.

dialogue.text: Yes, Sir!

dialogue.text: Right away, Sir. I'll send you a new one to the hotel.

dialogue.speaker: SHADOW

dialogue.speaker: SHADOW

dialogue.text: What's this... have you been smoking... ?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Smoking?  I'm not smoking.

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: Your clothing reeks of it.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: You know, Amy, I've been sitting around in bars and everywhere following this guy... I mean, is this what I get first thing?  Before you even "hello," you accuse me... ?

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: I'm not accusing you...

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Well, I'm not smoking, okay?

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: Okay, I believe you.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: We've been all through that.  I've been on my best behavior.

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: How's the detective business?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Business was fine.  I'll tell you what, you couldn't pay me enough to live down there.

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: You better not be smoking, that's all I can say.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Honey, I'm not, please...

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: I love you.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: I love you.

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: You think you'll have time for the water heater this weekend?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Sure.  I'll call the guy.

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: You're not using the same guy who tried to fix it?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: I'm not using him again for anything.  He was worthless.  You have bridge here Saturday?

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: Betty's out of town so we're playing next week.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: This is the mortgage.  This is Cindy's college money.

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: I understand.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Sometimes you can't know what I'm doing.  It's better that way.

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: I know.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: It's a missing persons case... a long shot.  I'll give it two months, two months at most, then I'll be back.  We'll take a vacation.

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: Why the gun?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: I'm not gonna need it.  I won't even wear it.  It's a precaution.  Don't worry about me.

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: Hello?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Amy, it's me.  Listen very carefully..

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: Tom?  Where have you been... ?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Amy, just listen.  Take Cindy and get out of the house.  Do it now. Go to a hotel and stay there...

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: What's wrong?  Are you alright?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: I'm okay.  Please, honey, I can't explain.  Don't use the phone, just pack a bag and get out.  I'm on my way.  I'll be back at the house in three hours.  Call me from the hotel when you get there

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: ... What's going on?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Just do it, Amy, please, go.

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: What happened to you?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: I'm okay, honey, I'm okay.  Are you alright?

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: What's going on, Tom?  What happened?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: I can't tell you, Amy.  You know I can't.  You have to trust me...

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: Tom...

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: It has to be this way for now.  It won't be long.

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: Why haven't you called?  Why don't you answer your phone?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: I don't know.  I'm sorry...

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: You're sorry?  What was I supposed to think?

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: You owe me an explanation.  You can't treat me like this.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: I wanted to call.  I couldn't.

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: You couldn't?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: You don't understand...

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: No, I don't, because you're not telling me anything!

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: I was in hell.  If I called you... if I heard your voice... it would have been so easy for me to quit. I couldn't do that.

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: You should have.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Amy, I'm not going to let anything happen to us.

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: Look where we are.  Look at yourself.  You son of a bitch, you don't have any idea what you're putting me through...

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: I don't know what to say

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: You're killing me...

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Don't...

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: What was I supposed to think happened to you?!

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Amy...

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: Who are you calling?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Mrs. Christian.

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: She's all I've got.  She's the only witness.

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: Tom... she's dead.

dialogue.speaker: AMY
dialogue.text: She died in her sleep three days ago.  It was in the paper...

dialogue.text: I just talked to her.

dialogue.text: There's nothing harder.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES

dialogue.speaker: WELLES

dialogue.speaker: DINO
dialogue.text: What are you talking about?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: The loop!  The girl we did, what the fuck do you think I'm talking about?!  This guy calls and says he knows about the fucking loop...

dialogue.speaker: DINO
dialogue.text: Bullshit.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: I'm telling you...

dialogue.speaker: DINO
dialogue.text: Blow me, you paranoid fuck, that's impossible.  Why are you bothering me with this... ?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Because somebody just fucking called me and fucking laid it out!

dialogue.speaker: DINO
dialogue.text: There's nothing there, you brain- dead cunt.  Think about it.  There's absolutely no way in this world to connect us to anything.  I want you to hang the phone up, and if you call me about this again I'm going to send a friend of mine out there and have him crack you open with a fucking rib spreader.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Dino...

dialogue.speaker: DINO
dialogue.text: Nobody knows anything.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: What the fuck... !

dialogue.text: I promised him to Machine.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: It's an honor to meet you.  Thank you for seeing us.

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: What can I do for you today?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: I'd like to commission a work.  I'm a great admirer of yours.

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: Flattering.  And, who's your colorful little chum?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: A fellow investor.

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: Hmm.

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: You said something about money.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Yes.  What we're looking for is rather specific.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: That's five thousand dollars.

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: Is it?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Five thousand now, five thousand on delivery. Two women, one white and one black, as long as they have large breasts. Hard bondage, or course.  Other than that, trusting your artistic interpretation, I have only two stipulations.

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: And they are?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: I want to watch you work.

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: I'll consider it.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: And the other performer... it has to be that monster you use... the man in the mask.

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: Machine.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: If it's not him, there's no deal.

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: He might be interested... but it would mean another five thousand.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: We can do that.

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: Well, well, I'll have to put my thinking-cap on about all this. You'll leave the money as a deposit?  Very good.

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: You have a beautiful face... the way the light hits it.  I'd like to take your picture.  You don't mind?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: I'd rather you didn't.

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: What's the problem?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: I'm camera shy.

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: You trust me to keep your money, but not to take your picture?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Those are two different kinds of trust.  Thank you for your time.  I hope we can do business.

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: I'll do this for you.  Fifteen thousand dollars.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Machine's in?

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: He's in.  It will be his pleasure.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Where's that?

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: Brooklyn.  Don't be late.

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: You brought the money?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Right here.

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: Excellent.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Where are the women?

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: They should be here any minute.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: What are these for?

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: Hmm?  Oh, the knifes?  They're just props.  Nice, aren't they?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Sure.

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: Mister Welles... would you be so kind as to remove any firearms from your person?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: What are you... ?

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: Take out your gun!

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: Empty the gun onto the table, very carefully.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Look, I don't know what this...

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: Shut up, cunt!  Do exactly as I say, or I'll put this arrow through your throat.

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: You remember Mr. Longdale, don't you?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: I remember him.

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: Friend of yours?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Look, he's got nothing to do with this... let him go...

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: Can you guess what I'm going to say next?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: He doesn't know anything... he's got nothing to do with this...

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: Bring the film, or we kill him.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: I'll get it.  It's in a safe deposit box, in the city...

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: How cooperative.  Longdale will keep you company.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Is that him?

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: Put the gun down, take the handcuffs.  Handcuff yourself to the bed.

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: Don't let Longdale's questionable choice of weapon give you any ideas. If his fey little gun puts enough little holes in you, you'll be just as dead... and so will Max.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Move it, dirtbag... !

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: You're a dead man.

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: Leave him alone.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Fuck off.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: ... sorry...

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: First things first.  You might want to watch this, Mr. Welles...

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: You got the guts, tough guy?  Gonna kill us all, is that it?

dialogue.speaker: DINO VELVET
dialogue.text: You betrayed us.

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: What can I do for you, Mr. Welles?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Call me Tom.

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: Alright, Tom.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: What I'd like, very simply, is access to your archive.  And, now I understand this isn't something you normally do for private citizens...

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: There are reasons for the way we do things here.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Absolutely.  Of course I'll abide by whatever decision you make, but I'd appreciate if you'll hear me out...

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Few days ago, I was contacted by a couple living in Philadelphia, a doctor and his wife.  What happened was they picked up a young girl hitchhiking off 81, which heads into Philadelphia, started up a conversation with this girl, she looked homeless, seemed about eighteen maybe.  They convinced her to let them buy her a meal in the city.  Nice kid, mature, didn't have much to say, but they got a sense she's a runaway, so all through dinner the doctor's working on her, trying to convince her that at the very least she should pick up a telephone.  Not surprisingly, she ate her food, excused herself...  That's the last they saw her.  The reason they came to me for help, the reason I'm coming to you, is we had a friend of mine in the department work up a sketch...  They want to see if I can I.D. this girl, somehow pass along a message to let the parents know the kid's alive, doing alright.

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: Why not go to the N.C.I.C. or N.C.M.E.C.?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: I figured you share information.

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: We do.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: For whatever reasons I thought you might be more receptive.

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: Why don't they come to me?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: This doctor and wife, they're nice people, but they don't want to get too involved.  They're not trying to have the parents come looking for the girl either. You and I both know sometimes, not often, but sometimes there's real reasons why a kid'll run. Molestation, whatever.  Besides that, the girl's probably eighteen, so she's legal.

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: I'm not so sure about this.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: They're putting themselves in place of this kid's parents and thinking they'd want to hear their girl's okay, even if that's all they hear.

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: I can give you my card, if your clients want to call me...

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: They were pretty clear they didn't want this coming back on them.

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: Well, that's all I can do.  Sorry.

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: Files are mostly by state and year of disappearance.  We try to keep the children and adults separate. No eating or smoking in here, but there's a coffee machine in the hall.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Any good?

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: It's horrible, but it'll be your best friend after a few days.  I hope you realize what kind of long shot you're chasing after.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: You're gonna be seeing a lot of me. You're sure you don't mind?

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: It's good what you're doing.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Celebrity Films.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Eddie.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Yeah, who's this?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: I know what you did.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: I know what you did.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Who is this.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: You murdered that girl, Eddie.  Six years ago...

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: What the fuck are you.. ?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: You killed that girl and you put it on film.  You and your pals, you're fucked.  You fucked up real good.

dialogue.text: What's he talking about?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: One million dollars, Dino.  How much did he tell you he had...

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: I'm gonna kill you.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Don't bore me with that bullshit.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: How'd you find me here?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Don't ask questions.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: Fuck you!

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Starting to recognize a pattern?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: What do you want?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Who is Machine?

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: I don't know...

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: I want his name.

dialogue.speaker: EDDIE
dialogue.text: I told you, I don't know.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: I will never get tired of hurting you, Eddie, so you might want to change your attitude.
